delivering high-performing specialised travel technicians <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for a team of specialized travel technicians. They’ll be working out of Denmark and United Kingdom and are all working across all our wind farms in region Europe.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Special Tasks &amp; Inspections<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Special Tasks &amp; Inspections Travel Technicians where you, together with your colleagues, will deliver a competent and specialized workforce supporting Offshore Operations by performing inspections and special tasks activities across all wind farms in region Europe. You’ll be working closely with ST&amp;I Project Management, ST&amp;I Offshore Management, ST&amp;I Technical Management, and other teams within the area of Generation Project and Campaigns. As a team, we deliver a safe, efficient, and cost optimised, high quality operation. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>building, leading, and further developing a team of highly specialised travel technicians<\u002Fli>\n  <li> setting team priorities and developing strategies supporting the continued growth<\u002Fli>\n  <li> enforcing a strong QHSE culture and awareness<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring the continued development of the travel technicians’ competencies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> optimising the utilisation of travel technicians during weather days and other stand still periods<\u002Fli>\n  <li> establishing relevant work permits for the travel technicians.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have proven leadership skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong interpersonal skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are experienced in leading from a distance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong English skills, both spoken and written<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess good knowledge of Microsoft Office and preferred basic knowledge of SAP.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. <p>Imagine a future where you turn your passion into action and create a world that runs on green energy by supporting the PMO and Business Management team in QHSE <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll support the Portfolio Management Office and lead a group of 4 administrative trainees in QHSE. You’ll administer their training and development with support from the Ørsted Trainee Programme responsible. You’ll also supervise the trainee’s work, support the various QHSE departments and be responsible for the QHSE SharePoint sites. The support for the Portfolio Management Office entails the administrative support for the office in portfolio and project management.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to PMO and Business Management<\u002Fb><br> You'll be part of a small team of project specialists in the Project Management Office and a team providing support for the QHSE Management team and department. Together with your colleagues, you’ll have a number of responsibilities, incl. administrative support to QHSE departments, specific tasks for the QHSE Senior Leadership team, various types of support for the PMO in project portfolio management, and arranging meetings and events, preparing presentations, and supporting the QHSE onboarding. As a team, we embrace the many different challenges we get, and besides getting the job done, we ensure that they act as learning experiences. We have a work culture characterised by trust and openness.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>leading the QHSE administrative trainees and follow up on their training and well-being<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing administrative support for the Portfolio Management Office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> handling presentations and preparations for meetings and calendar administration<\u002Fli>\n  <li> administering internal SharePoint sites, and supporting the QHSE Senior Leadership team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the Head of department and providing back-up assistance for the SVP of QHSE.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>are fluent in English and Danish, both in writing and orally<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have IT skills in Microsoft office and Microsoft Outlook, with knowledge of Microsoft SharePoint<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have the ability to prioritise tasks within a fast-paced environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong interpersonal with an understanding of the dynamics of a large international organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 30 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Per Kampp, Head of PMO and Business Management, on (Denmark +45) 99552170 if you’d like to know more about the position. operated portfolio by driving cross-portfolio initiatives <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be instrumental in the development and structuring of the commercial information management system, process landscape, and creating and optimizing the tools and processes required for the asset management function to work more efficiently. In addition, you’ll be leading or contributing on other CoEx projects, based on both your skillset and interests. Finally, the role requires that you enjoy engaging with stakeholders at all levels across the organization.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Welcome to UK Commercial<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Commercial Center of Expertise (CoEx) where you, together with your four highly skilled and commercially minded colleagues, will support the offshore asset management function globally in the Own and Operate lifecycle phase. You’ll seek to bind the global commercial areas more tightly together by ensuring we share best practices, work more effectively, and standardize across the portfolio. As a team, we value trust, openness, a healthy balanced work environment and the tone is informal. Team members are empowered and encouraged to make decisions on the projects they are responsible for.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>optimizing the Information Management System used by the asset and business management organization in the Own and Operate lifecycle phase of our offshore windfarms<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the on-going development, implementation, and operation of the Contract Management Tool<\u002Fli>\n  <li> accessing and user management for systems, mailings lists, in connection with on boarding, offboarding, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> running and contributing to smaller value-adding projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the Head of UK Commercial with ad hoc admin tasks, such as meeting bookings, event planning, expense settlements, etc.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a structured approach to your work and likewise instinctively enjoy applying structure to problems you are given<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are detail-oriented and take pride in delivering a high-quality product<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have good IT skills and are, ideally, experienced in working with information management systems and process tools and landscapes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are proactive, self-driven, and able to identify and implement solutions to problems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong communicative skills and can communicate clearly with internal stakeholders at both specialist and management level<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English fluently.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 2 February 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Please don’t hesitate to contact Philip Ferreira Fleischer, Head of UK Commercial Management - CoEx, on (Denmark +45) 99552064, if you’d like to know more about the position. first-and second line on-site IT support<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll provide on-site support for our colleagues in West Denmark, meeting them either at our support counter in Skærbæk near Frederica or at their workplace, incl. at power plants and operation and maintenance sites for wind farms and local sites. We provide device support for our end-users, typically relating to laptops, mobile phones, and tablets. But we also build stationary workstations designed for specific tasks. You’ll be introduced to new systems and solutions, and you’ll have a high degree of influence on these.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to IT<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Digital Device Support where you, together with your colleagues, will deliver online IT support and device services in 12 countries. Each country has its own primary support team, but we have a lot of virtual cooperation, as well as global competence- and team meetings. You’ll be part of a work-rotation scheme and switch between different roles where you, on some days, will drive out to meet and support users on-site and on other days, you’ll provide support at the counter or prepare equipment for new employees. As a team, we’re characterised by a good cooperation and a working environment based on mutual trust. All the team members have an individual development plan, and we support our colleagues in finding new opportunities in their work life. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>primarily helping our employees with on-site support for their different hardware and light software support needs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> solving first and second-level incidents and responding to service requests from our service management systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing walk-in support for our employees at their workplace where you’ll meet both Danish and international colleagues<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preparing IT equipment for new employees<\u002Fli>\n  <li> securing a high level of user satisfaction through customer orientation and a customer-service mindset.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a technical degree and background in IT, such as IT supporter, data technician, or similar<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are technically minded and used to providing technical support for PCs, mobile phones, and iPads (iOS)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have knowledge of, and experience with, installing laptops using SCCM, MS Office 365, Windows 10., and support of AV systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English at business level<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess good communication skills and can explain complex technical issues in an easily understandable way.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 10 February 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Per T. Larsen, Head of Service &amp; Support CE CC, on (Denmark +45) 99556724 on Mondays to Fridays between 08:00-15:30 GMT; GMT Standard Time if you’d like to know more about the position. leadership position through new innovative offerings <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for managing the overall innovation portfolio and supporting with several operational program support activities across all our programs and teams in adherence to assortment analysis and the overall strategy. Together with the Head of Portfolio Management you’ll play a vital role in implementing processes and tools to ensure an optimal impact of the Innovation Portfolio Management function in the overall structure of the Innovation Department and collaboration with our key stakeholders.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Innovation<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Innovation Portfolio Management where you, together with your colleagues, will strive to execute on our mission to future-proof the organisation by ensuring long-term value creation and growth objectives with novel solutions. The area consists of four functional areas and three programs. Our program directors and our team leads are essential stakeholders in this position, however, stakeholder relations with other support functions, such as Finance and IT, will also be required. As a team, we 're highly diverse, dynamic, and collaborative, fostering a strongly social environment whilst priding ourselves in our inclusive ways of working and our focus on psychological safety.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>continuously improving our ways of working, especially with program portfolio management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> assisting the Head of Innovation Portfolio Management with various operational program support activities across all our programs and teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> coordinating and implementing various processes and tools to support the portfolio management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> maintaining and coordinating the Innovation &amp; Sustainability Catalogue<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting and coordinating the team with several of outreach initiatives to ensure awareness and insight to our work, as well as that knowledge is managed correctly, both internally and externally.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>are a skilled and curious people person, with a growth mind-set<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a proactive and structured approach to your work and a good eye for detail<\u002Fli>\n  <li> gain energy from working with others, but aren’t afraid to take it upon yourself to solve operational and structured tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have solid communication skills and enjoy working in a dynamic environment with a group of cross-functional and global stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are familiar with process improvement work and have the ability to work in workshop settings and with writing standard operating procedures<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a passion for technology, innovation, collaboration, and renewable energy.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 10. helping to create a world that runs entirely on green energy <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll work directly with our Senior Management team, together with the rest of the Corporate Strategy team, on Ørsted’s overall strategy and key strategic projects across our portfolio of renewable technologies. A role in Corporate Strategy not only ensures a high degree of impact for the future of the most sustainable energy company in the world, but also a high degree of personal development across problem-solving and project management.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Corporate Strategy<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Corporate Strategy where you, together with your colleagues, will work as an in-house consulting team supporting our CEO, CFO, Regions, P2X &amp; Sustainability, on various strategic topics. You’ll also be part of the wider Strategy area which together helps define the overall strategic agenda for the organisation. The position entails a high degree of stakeholder management for the various parts of the organisation. Our team is positioned centrally and we typically need to manage viewpoints for various stakeholders and consolidate these into holistic recommendations. As a team, we’re committed to working for a world that runs entirely on green energy, ensuring a high degree of team feeling, and developing your skills and talents for a successful future career at Ørsted.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>supporting and driving strategic projects for the Group Executive team, incl. problem solving, development of top-down storylines, and insights which will lay the foundation for strategic decisions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> gathering, researching, and analysing quantitative and qualitative information from across the organisation and from external sources, translating this into clear insights<\u002Fli>\n  <li> identifying challenges and opportunities for the organisation to scope and drive strategic projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing key stakeholders across the organisation to best drive projects forward with the necessary input and ensure alignment where needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> helping build and prepare internal and external presentations and decision materials for the Group Executive team and the Board of Directors.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have +2 years of experience in top-tier consulting, banking, or strategy in major companies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a high willingness to learn, a can-do mindset for challenging tasks, and a strong personal drive to get your tasks done<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a personal drive and ambition to help solve the global climate challenge and key challenges facing the energy sector today<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong analytical skills and an ability to distil key insights from a large amount of information<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a curious and collaborative mindset and strong ability to work with people across different disciplines. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 1 February 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Vilhelm Vig Nielsen, Head of Corporate Strategy, on (Denmark +45) 99556484 on Mondays from 10:30-11:00 GMT; GMT Standard Time if you’d like to know more about the position. certificates. You’ll be an integral part of a team with competent and committed colleagues. As a team, we value and emphasise knowledge sharing and collaboration as a way of working. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>optimising our renewable certificate portfolio, developing trading strategies and market analysis<\u002Fli>\n  <li> identifying, developing, and executing certificate transactions, with a focus on value creation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> building a pipeline of certificate deal opportunities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing and maintaining external relationships to enable certificate trading activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the Group’s renewable projects and initiatives by advising on certificate markets, price quoting for PPAs, and other non-standard transactions.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a proven track record developing and executing transactions and have work experience in commodity trading, preferably in certificates or other non-standard products<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are ambitious and have a commercial and entrepreneurial approach<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a team player and are able to focus on team objectives, as well as your own<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are analytical and structured in your approach to your tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are open to taking on ad hoc tasks to deliver our objectives. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. You’ll utilise and develop your skills with EU tenders in close cooperation with skilled project managers, technicians, QHSE partners, and external consultants, thereby supporting our vision of a world that runs entirely on green energy. Also, you’ll be the one taking ownership of the continued optimisation and development of the procurement function.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Bioenergy<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Combined Heat and Power (CHP) Procurement where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for cross functional and complex sourcing activities related to our carbon neutral energy production at our power plants in Denmark. The team supports the business with category management and sourcing management and is anchored in a large, rapidly expanding, and leading procurement organisation, ensuring collaboration across the company and access to knowledge sessions and specialist training programmes. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>running EU tender projects, where you’re a key player in managing all sourcing activities across different strategic business units<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing and executing sourcing strategies for OPEX and CAPEX projects for our Danish power plants<\u002Fli>\n  <li> building and maintaining relationships with internal and external stakeholders on all levels of the organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> negotiating complex contracts, ensuring high value results for Ørsted and our supplier base.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in a commercial or engineering field, combined with work experience within international procurement and EU tender law<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong communication skills and speak and write fluent English, enabling you to communicate and negotiate with your business partners in an international environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a proactive approach, positive mindset, and the ability to see opportunities and act on it<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive in a fast-paced work environment, and see the value of working in a structured manner<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess strong interpersonal skills which allow for a high level of stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Bettina Bachmann, Head of CHP Procurement, on (Denmark +45) 99555230 on Mondays to Fridays from 08:00-17:00 CET; Central European Time, if you’d like to know more about the position. <\u002Fp>\n <p>If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your supporting our growing green global footprint <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll support our organisation in maintaining and developing a fit-for-purpose Global Real Estate (Office) Portfolio. You’ll also play an important part in reaching our goal to align processes and strategies throughout our global portfolio.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Global Real Estate &amp; Workplace Management<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Global Real Estate Management where you, together with a team of highly skilled Real Estate professionals, will work with a growing global platform as we locate, negotiate, and manage office lease globally. You’ll work primarily across continental Europe, but also in other regions globally, leading transactions and managing stakeholders as well as our footprint, while working closely with the rest of the team to ensure that we meet all obligations in a timely manner. As a team, we thrive on taking ownership of our individual tasks whilst still managing to work closely together and support each other, even if we are located in different countries and offices.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>leading corporate real estate office transactions across Europe and globally, securing best terms aligned with the business outlook<\u002Fli>\n  <li> optimising the current portfolio, securing maximum flexibility and efficiency, as well as cost optimisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading rent and capacity reviews, scoping and forecasting site growth and location strategy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> processing the needs of the business and securing corporate mandates throughout the transaction process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> negotiating lease contracts and securing the most optimal and flexible lease terms aligned with the business needs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting stakeholder management, acting as liaison between our organisation, landlords, and brokers, as well as internal stakeholder expectations, and aligning with FM, P&amp;D, Legal, and Global Insurance, etc.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>are an experienced transaction manager and have a proven track record as a manager of leasehold contracts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> understand and display very good knowledge of the commercial real estate market, primarily across Europe and to some extent globally<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can manage stakeholder expectations and steer negotiations to the desired outcome, while keeping an eye on details<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are conceptually skilled and have a firm understanding of key cost drivers and landlord perspectives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are proactive and curious, following existing processes whilst suggesting changes when needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are collaborative, efficient, bright, perseverant, and have good communications skills to support your position in a global organisation.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application and CV in English to us no later than 30 January 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Katrine Falkenloeve Erichsen, Head of Global Real Estate Management, on (Denmark +45) 25322832 from Mondays to Fridays from 08:00-12:00 CET, if you’d like to know more about the position. <p>Forestil dig en fremtid, hvor du og dine kolleger er ansvarlige for en stabil og sikker drift af Anholt Havmøllepark<\u002Fp> \n <p>I denne rolle vil du og dine kolleger være ansvarlige for den daglige drift og vedligeholdelse af Anholt Havmøllepark. Havvindmølleparken består af 111 havvindmøller med en samlet kapacitet på 400 MW, der er placeret 15 km fra land.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Velkommen til Anholt Havmøllepark<\u002Fb><br> Du bliver del af Anholt Operation teamet på Anholt Havmøllepark, hvor du sammen med dine kolleger kommer til at holde vindmøllerne kørende. Du bliver en del af et engageret team af havvindmølleteknikere, og derudover samarbejder du tæt med andre onshore-kolleger og -teknikere fra vores leverandører. Her arbejdes der på en 7\u002F7-turnus med daglig afgang fra vores servicebygninger på Grenå Havn. I vores team er der stor fokus på sikkerhed og samarbejde. Der arbejdes i et dynamisk miljø, hvor alle støtter op om alle, og hvor der ikke er langt til faglig support. Der hersker en stor faglig stolthed.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> I jobbet vil du:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> udføre fejlfinding og løse opgaver vedrørende service og vedligeholdelse af havvindmølleparken og dens tilhørende materiel<\u002Fli>\n  <li> løse ad hoc-opgaver i forbindelse med driftsstop og havari på havvindmølleparken<\u002Fli>\n  <li> være med til at udføre årligt service<\u002Fli>\n  <li> deltage i projektorienterede opgave<\u002Fli>\n  <li> medvirke til løbende at udvikle vores havvindmøllepark og organisation.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> For at få succes i denne rolle forventer vi, at du:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> har en uddannelse inden for metal-, el- eller automatikfagene, gerne kombineret med erfaring inden for vindmøllebranchen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> er i stand til at arbejde med hydrauliske og elektriske systemer samt styringssystemer<\u002Fli>\n  <li> har erfaring med IT på brugerniveau, da store dele af vores vedligeholdelses- og rapporteringssystem primært er dokumenteret i elektronisk form<\u002Fli>\n  <li> behersker dansk og engelsk i skrift og tale – dette er vigtigt, eftersom du indgår som medarbejder i en multikulturel organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> har en ansvarsbevidst indstilling til dit arbejde kombineret med en analytisk tilgang til dine opgaver.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Få et job, der gør en forskel<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted er kåret som verdens mest bæredygtige energiselskab, og som global leder står vi i spidsen af klimakampen. Hos os vil du være med til at skabe og drive de ændringer, der kan lede til en grøn fremtid indenfor energi. Du vil styrke dit talent i en hurtigt voksende branche, hvor du vil have mulighed for at lære og udvikle dig gennem udfordrende opgaver og i samarbejde med førende eksperter. Her vil du arbejde i et behageligt arbejdsmiljø baseret på tillid, respekt og samarbejde.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Form fremtiden med os<\u002Fb><br> Send din ansøgning til os så hurtigt som muligt og senest den 10 Februar 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Du er velkommen til at kontakte Morten Dommerbye, Operations Manager, på (Denmark +45) 99558575, tirsdage og torsdage fra 09:00-15:00 GMT; hvis du vil vide mere om stillingen.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Hvis du ønsker at anmode om justeringer af arbejdsmetoder, arbejdsmønstre eller vurderings- eller interviewprocessen, tager vi med glæde en snak om alternative arrangementer.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Bemærk venligst, at din ansøgning kun bliver taget i betragtning, hvis den indsendes via vores online karriereside.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Om jobbet<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Ansøgningsfrist:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> 10 Februar 2023, 23:59 CET <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Land:<\u002Fb> Denmark <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Grenå <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Arbejdssted:<\u002Fb> On-site <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Arbejdstid:<\u002Fb> Full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Morten Dommerbye <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Operations Manager <\u002Fp>\n   <p>(Denmark +45) 99558575 <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Tirsdag og Torsdag fra 09:00-15:00 GMT <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>Forestil dig en fremtid med Ørsted <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>Om Ørsted<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Vi udvikler, opfører og driver hav- og landvindmølleparker samt solcelle-, energilagrings- og bioenergianlæg i Europa, Asien og Nord Amerika.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Vores vision er at skabe en verden, der udelukkende kører på grøn energi.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Vi er de seneste fire år blevet kåret som verdens mest bæredygtige energiselskab.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Vi har hovedsæde i Danmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Vi har mere end 8.000 medarbejdere globalt og kontorer i 15 lande.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> Et inkluderende team<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted ønsker at alle medarbejdere har samme muligheder for at gøre en forskel uanset alder, nationalitet, funktionsnedsættelse, etnicitet, køn, seksuel orientering eller tro. Vi har stort fokus på at have et mangfoldigt arbejdsmiljø, hvor alle medarbejdere åbent kan give input og dele ideer.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Hvorfor blive en del af Ørsted?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Bliv en del af en organisation med dokumenteret høj medarbejdertilfredshed og motivation\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Oplev løbende muligheder for læring og You’ll be an important part of a duty roster to ensure that the Operations EPIC Center is open 24\u002F7 in a global company where business units are working in different time zones. As a team, we drive our EPIC Center, assuming responsibility for the daily operation of Ørsted IT. The team is closely knitted together by their skillset, professionalism, as well as a strong sense of humour.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>independently taking great responsibility to drive forward problems, incidents, and service requests, ensuring KPI adherence and assuming responsibility for driving major incidents<\u002Fli>\n  <li> acting as change manager ensuring compliance and scheduling of changes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> taking on the role as Operations Manager, who is responsible for all activities in the Operations Center on a day-to-day basis<\u002Fli>\n  <li> participating in ad-hoc task such as developing, reporting, and optimising procedures<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being part of an exciting agile team, planning and delivering products based on SAFe agile framework.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have solid experience in working within the field of IT operations, preferably both infrastructure and applications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a broad technical understanding and a natural curiosity that drives you to learn new things<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive with daily operational tasks and at the same time have a passion for bringing new ideas into the team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have the ability to seek commitment and engage with all stakeholders, from technical experts to senior management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong language skills in English and Danish as you have the responsibility for communicating company-wide on a regular basis<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have solid experience from a similar role in an enterprise context.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 17 February 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Marlene Fauerholdt Jensen, Head of Application &amp; Operation Mgmt CC, on (Denmark +45) 99554844 if you’d like to know more about the position. global IT services and products to our internal customers<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll work within our IT Service Delivery Management team, where we focus on ensuring high customer satisfaction, stable operations, and continuous improvements, by continuously engaging in a close dialogue with our global stakeholders. As part of building relationships with the Ørsted business and our internal technical IT teams, you’ll help build and provide relevant performance reporting and help to resolve complaints and pain points, by raising attention and anchoring issues in our agile Product Lines. In other words, you’ll be key in bridging the Ørsted business and IT.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Center of Excellence Service Delivery Management<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of our global Service Delivery Management team where you, together with your colleagues, will be a part of a cross-functional, global team consisting of service delivery managers and service transition managers. Your key area of responsibility will be to support two Agile Release Trains (ART´s) with Service Delivery capabilities, ensuring the delivery of products and services to the business according to agreement, whilst also increasing the level of operational maturity. Amongst other core tasks, you’ll also ensure reporting and transparency, as well as help safeguard operations in third party contracts. As a team, we work with other service delivery management tasks across Ørsted IT, incl. SLA\u002FOLAs and KPI reporting. We aim to deliver through a team effort and in a professional way.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>establishing a good relationship with key stakeholders and ensuring an organisational focus on issues raised to achieve a high level of satisfaction in the delivery of IT services <\u002Fli>\n  <li>acting and responding as the go-to person for two Agile Release Trains on a broad scope of IT enquiries and issues, incl. participating in the System team in the Agile Release Train to enforce and support IT service management disciplines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> continuously building and maintaining the right service delivery framework and toolbox<\u002Fli>\n  <li> establishing the necessary SLA and ensuring transparency into reporting and KPIs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading initiatives to improve on operational maturity and increase the quality of IT services we deliver as an organisation, e.g., participation in tenders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> participating in our Change Advisory Board (CAB) to meet customer needs and ensure a high quality of technical changes within IT. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have some years’ experience as a service delivery manager, IT management consultant, or similar, in a global organisation and at enterprise level <\u002Fli>\n  <li>have a consultancy mindset with the flexibility of managing a variety of tasks, combining people skills and IT knowledge, whilst keeping sight of business value in an agile environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience in collaborating with both infrastructure and application management specialists, as well as communicating efficiently with management and specialists on different levels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent communication skills and a personal drive to achieve results<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have good team-building skills and the ability to cooperate within virtual teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have the ability to set the scene, providing a clear agenda, leading across various teams, staying focused, handling pressure well, and can work through resistance to get things done.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 27 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Dorte Rasmussen, Head of Service Delivery Management CoE, on (Denmark +45) 99559064 from 08:00-10:00 CET; Central European Time, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> 27 January 2023, 23:59 CET <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> Denmark <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Skærbæk <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Hybrid (office and home-working) <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> Full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Dorte Rasmussen <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Head of Service Delivery Management CoE <\u002Fp>\n   <p>(Denmark +45) 99559064<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>About Ørsted<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We develop, construct, and operate offshore and onshore wind farms, solar energy farms, storage facilities, and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company for the past four years.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re headquartered in Denmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We have over 7,292 employees, working in 15 countries and growing.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> An inclusive team<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted wants all employees to have the same opportunities for impact and growth, regardless of age, nationality, disability, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or beliefs. enabling us to reach our ambitions within renewable energy<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll function as the project coordinator for all our ongoing projects, incl. preparation, planning, designing, implementation, and handover of security projects, to ensure that the team adheres to the budget and meets all necessary deadlines. You’ll primarily focus on electrical installations, e.g., intrusion detection and alarm systems, latest camera and radar systems, and different access control systems. You’ll be offered exciting, international, and challenging tasks where the solutions involve a great deal of responsibility and requires great independence and good collaboration skills. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Welcome to Global Real Estate and Workplace Management<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Global Site &amp; Building Security where you, together with your colleagues, will be working with security projects at our power plants, offshore and onshore wind farms, maintenance and operation facilities, port and harbour areas, production sites, warehouses, electricity storages facilities, solar farms, P2X, and office facilities worldwide. You’ll be a part of our Security Physical &amp; Technical team, consisting of three security technician specialists, working with security projects worldwide. As a team, we prioritise helping and supporting each other in an open and friendly working environment to provide the best solutions. We foster a work culture where we embrace learning opportunities and share experiences. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>ensuring the careful organisation of the schedule, budget, and details of a given task<\u002Fli>\n  <li> communicating with various stakeholders to keep everyone on board about any changes to the project plan<\u002Fli>\n  <li> creating a positive ambience in the team <\u002Fli>\n  <li>taking a leading role to get things done in a positive way<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being open to new ways of working <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a relevant professional education, e.g., as a construction technician, machinist, electrician, security technician, or similar<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess experience with project work, preferably from the security or construction industry and ideally with international experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have knowledge of technical security solutions, e.g., alarm systems, camera surveillance, access control, radar, drone detection and interception, fire detection and suppression systems, or biometric systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with and are currently certified within project management e.g., PRINCE2, AGILE, or PMP.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with budgeting and financial management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess good collaboration skills as a team player who can also work independently.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 21 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Thomas Lorenzen, Head of Global Security Operations, on (Denmark +45) 99555665 on Tuesdays to Thursdays from 10:00-12:00 GMT if you’d like to know more about the position. As a geophysicist, you’ll be responsible for the geophysical survey aspects in all project phases and experience how the offshore wind power business looks from the front line. Furthermore, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to the development of new tools and innovative solutions for further enhanced value creation across the Ørsted portfolio.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to GEO<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Geophysical Surveys where you, together with your colleagues, will handle the technical management of the geophysical surveys and challenge the survey industry standards by constantly striving for continuous improvements. The Geophysical Surveys team consists of 15 dedicated people spread across three countries who design and execute high-quality geophysical surveys in order to support the engineering challenges and regulatory requirements in our projects. As a team, we acknowledge that good performance and a meaningful work culture comes out of strong relations, mutual trust, curiosity, and a psychologically safe environment, where every voice counts.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>being responsible for designing geophysical surveys, incl. preparation of technical material, participation in kick-off meetings with various contractors, mobilisations, and port calls<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being responsible for managing survey operations and contractor deliveries, incl. vessel calls, weekly processing meetings with contractors, and data quality assurance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> UXO risk mitigation from the development phase towards the construction of our offshore wind farms<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being responsible for driving quality into the acquired data and maximising its value through proactive stakeholder engagement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> joining a project-specific site investigation team consisting of project managers, geophysical assessment engineers, geotechnical engineers, and construction managers.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>ideally have offshore experience within shallow geophysical data acquisition and processing, incl. bathymetry, side-scan sonar, magnetometer, sub-bottom profiler, and UHR seismic methods<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a relevant degree in earth sciences<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English fluently<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent communication skills, enabling you to convey your messages smoothly and efficiently when interacting with your stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a proactive and systematic approach to your work tasks and thrive on being in a dynamic working environment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 29 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Jeppe Bloch Lauridsen, Head of Geophysical Surveys, on (Denmark +45) 99554757, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that you’re expected to do some travelling in relation to your work, as you’ll be participating in kick-off meetings, processing meetings, and other project meetings, as well as various departmental activities over the cycle of a year.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n facilities, and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the internal controls framework <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll lead Internal Control Assurance, a team of six talented professionals focusing on embedding and developing our global internal controls framework covering the financial, ESG, and ITGC areas.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Group Finance<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Group Finance where you, together with your colleagues, will facilitate the annual risk assessment, provide advisory support to develop the first-line processes and control environment, monitor the controls are being performed, test the effectiveness of the controls, and report on the control framework to Senior Management and the Audit &amp; Risk Committee. You’ll report to the Head of Group Finance with 35 colleagues that besides ICA and handing of insurances, are focusing on internal and external reporting of the Group’s consolidated financial and ESG data. As a team, we prioritise helping and supporting each other in an open and friendly working environment to provide the best solutions and learn from experiences.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>setting the overall direction for, and ensuring a continuous development of, the Group’s control framework and environment, incl. spearheading risk management, awareness and facilitating a strong control culture<\u002Fli>\n  <li> engaging with key stakeholders, incl. internal and external auditors, and closely following best practices and where the business is headed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> overseeing and managing the yearly internal control risk assessment, documenting and testing the effectiveness of the controls, and ensuring that internal controls are being performed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing assurance to Senior Management and the Audit &amp; Risk Committee that sufficient controls are in place and appropriately designed and operated to mitigate risks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> expanding and standardising the control framework in line with the Group’s processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring the implementation and operation of a new internal control system.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>enjoy leading a team and believing that the delegation of tasks and collective efforts will bring better results and a great team spirit<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience as a line or project manager working with an internal control framework in a multinational company<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a relevant financial education, e.g., a master’s degree in auditing or finance, and understand classical accounting and controlling disciplines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> enjoy working with and managing stakeholders and are comfortable being exposed to top management levels and Committee members<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have great communication skills and a structured approach to your work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a keen eye for process improvements, automation, and are used to delivering high-quality assignments, even when deadlines are tight. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 29 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Jeppe Hoff Nielsen, Vice President, on (Denmark +45) 99559732, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> 29 January 2023, 23:59 CET <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> Denmark <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Gentofte <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Hybrid (office and home-working) <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> Full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Jeppe Hoff Nielsen <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Vice President <\u002Fp>\n   <p>(Denmark +45) 99559732<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>About Ørsted<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We develop, construct, and operate offshore and onshore wind farms, solar energy farms, storage facilities, and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company for the past four years.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re headquartered in Denmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We have over 7,292 employees, working in 15 countries and growing.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> An inclusive team<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted wants all employees to have the same opportunities for impact and growth, regardless of age, nationality, disability, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or beliefs. creation from the world’s largest offshore wind power portfolio <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be part of the fast-moving intraday trading team where you’ll be responsible for balancing and optimising the value gained from the renewable power production from our extensive offshore wind portfolio. You’ll be part of a duty roster, which actively trades power markets 24\u002F7, 365 days a year, and continuously work on improving our trading strategies and the technical set-up we work within. You’ll learn the fundamentals of the ever-changing energy markets and use this knowledge to create real world value from our renewable energy assets.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Power Portfolio<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Intraday Power where you, together with your colleagues, will be part of a world which is changing rapidly and therefore constantly must adapt to the situation we find ourselves in. You’ll primarily work from our headquarters in Gentofte, where the trading desk is situated. As a team, we are 12 bright and honest colleagues, who all trust and support each other. We have varied backgrounds and therefore English is often the preferred language in the team.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>participating in the 24\u002F7 duty roster, covering 365 days a year<\u002Fli>\n  <li> trading in the intraday markets to balance our power positions in Europe<\u002Fli>\n  <li> monitoring and deciding on short-term trading strategies for our offshore wind portfolio<\u002Fli>\n  <li> generating and driving improvement ideas for our analytical set-up, trading strategies, and operational set-up.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a master’s degree or plan to graduate soon within economics, science, engineering, or similar, combined with a sound understanding of financial products and logical reasoning<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are energetic and want to contribute to the development of trading strategies and bringing the operation into a more digital era<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can take the initiative, make decisions, and act based on market development or asset events<\u002Fli>\n  <li> stay calm in hectic situations and alert in calm situations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have an interest in acquiring in-depth knowledge of the European power market<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a team player and are willing to go the extra mile when needed to support your colleagues.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. The team is part of Products, Systems, and Data Analytics. Data &amp; Analytics is the backbone of what we do and the decisions we make. Across B2B Nordics, we are very dependent on each other to succeed; hence cooperation is key.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>structuring, maintaining, and operating the data and tools used in B2B Nordics to secure performance and management decision making<\u002Fli>\n  <li> building and implementing data structures that allow for reporting across the entire value chain<\u002Fli>\n  <li> delivering high-quality and value-adding data to support our B2B Nordics customers, teams, and business partners<\u002Fli>\n  <li> enabling our colleagues to understand and benefit from data<\u002Fli>\n  <li> optimising our business work processes.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have completed a degree within a quantitative-focused area<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a team player with strong technical skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> understand that strong data quality is the foundation of all subsequent benefits from using data<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience working with one or more of the following: Oracle, SQL, Python (Pandas), Power Bi, Alteryx, Tableau, or similar.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 7 February 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Diana Hornshoej Jensen, Senior Portfolio Manager, on (Denmark +45) 99557478, if you’d like to know more about the position. developing our organisation, enabling us to become a global green energy major <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll lead our efforts to transform our organisation as we accelerate our global growth. You'll drive the scoping, development, and implementation of strategic projects concerning our organisation and people, in collaboration with our People &amp; Development organisation, our community of strategy teams, and colleagues from all around our business. You’ll get the chance to work on a wide range of topics such as building the model and aspiration for how to globalise our organisation, deliver major reorganisations, enabling our organisation to scale for growth, deliver strategic workforce planning, and drive post-merger integration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to People &amp; Development<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of People Strategy where you, together with your colleagues, will be part of a small, international team of strategists. You'll have the unique opportunity to combine strategy development and project management with your profound interest in people and organisational topics. As a team, we work in a fast-paced, iterative manner, based on high ambitions for Ørsted. Our achievements root in caring collaboration, where we utilise each other’s strengths and support each other's development.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>scoping and executing strategic projects where you’ll lead your project teams to gather and analyse data, problem solve, and build top-down storylines delivered to senior management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being the glue that ties strategy development and implementation together through stakeholder and process management, and through close collaboration with the People &amp; Development organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the CHRO, CEO, and Group Executive team with presentations, analyses, and deep dives on relevant topics<\u002Fli>\n  <li> co-developing strategic recommendations together with the wider Ørsted strategy community to respond to changing business needs relevant for our organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> actively coaching junior colleagues in the team and on inter-functional project teams.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a strong consultant toolbox, an excellent analytical mindset, and proven problem-solving skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a flair for stakeholder management and building relationships, incl. having the ability to lead, formally or informally, team members in projects or in a cross-business engagement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are used to communicating complex topics in a clear and concise manner to senior management, both verbally and in writing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are ambitious and results-oriented with a natural can-do attitude, and have a high level of drive and perseverance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience in project management of global, complex projects, with the ability to scope and work independently.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 22 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Signe Skak, Head of Strategic Transf. sustainable energy company <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll bring your experience, ambition, and passion around talent, diversity, and inclusion to help our organisation grow more effectively around the world. You’ll work with leaders to develop talent across our global organisation that comprises both offshore and onshore wind farms where we create and develop green wind energy, hydrogen, and solar energy.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to People &amp; Development<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Diversity &amp; Talent team where you, together with your colleagues, will invest in the development of our people. You’ll redefine our approach to talent management, so you’ll shape this role and break new ground with global impact. You’ll be a part of an ambitious, original, and energising team where innovation, commercial focus, and curiosity are highly valued. We work flexibly within the team in order to lead and live sustainable holistic lives while being able to relate to a global organisation. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>leading the talent pipeline agenda that we deliver through the talent pipeline managers in the team you’ll lead<\u002Fli>\n  <li> reviewing, redesigning, and relaunching an equitable, simplified talent management processes, leading to the best possible experience for our talent and their leaders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing and tracking key performance indicators to ensure we understand the impact of our work and can adapt in light of what we learn<\u002Fli>\n  <li> engaging with senior stakeholders across our global organisation to maximise the business impact of our talent management agenda<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading a team of talent pipeline managers, ensuring they’re aligned, supported, and developed.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>demonstrate strong knowledge in talent management and know how to drive change in this space<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a proven ability to design equitable talent processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> understand how to maximise the partnership between an HR centre of excellence and HR business partners, as well as with business leadership<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are experienced in monitoring, analysing, and presenting data and using related insights to identify and deliver opportunities for change<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can motivate and inspire your team and a range of internal stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 23 January 2023. coding, and tagging systems in our offshore wind projects and power-to-x projects <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll become our new technical documentation specialist where you’ll work directly on our asset projects. You'll be supporting projects with Reference Designation System for Power Plants (RDS-PP) coding, validation and numbering, as well as driving internal improvement projects and initiatives. You’ll also work with external partners and suppliers on the development and standardisation of RDS-PP coding as well as other coding systems in the renewable energy sector.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Project Information Management<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Coding &amp; Tagging team where you, together with your colleagues, will collaborate with colleagues across the world in Asset Projects, and from the Operations team, to ensure the technical documentation is coded and validated before hand-over to operations. Part of the job is to train and upskill project colleagues and suppliers in using the right and tags in relation to technical documentation. Our team consists of six colleagues and is primarily based out of Denmark but works globally as a central global support function. As a team, we work, coordinate, and collaborate closely to support our project colleagues and operations to ensure progress and find solutions. We work independently as well as take time to learn together and from each other. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>planning, coordinating, facilitating and following up on technical documentation structure workshops with our asset projects <\u002Fli>\n  <li>validating structure and RDS-PP coding <\u002Fli>\n  <li>developing and running training sessions for your colleagues and suppliers.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a relevant technical background as an engineer or a BSc in marine engineering <\u002Fli>\n  <li>might have an electrical background and some experience from within the wind power and renewable industry, but this is not required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have previously worked with technical documentation and RDS-PP coding or other industrial numbering standards.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are motivated by, and have a flair for, systems and structure and would like to develop your competences within this field.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 19 February 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Torben Kjaer, Senior Manager, on (Denmark +45) 99557558 on Mondays to Fridays from 08:30-17:00 CET; Central European Time if you’d like to know more about the position. by driving digital and innovation product adoption <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll drive digital and innovation product adoption across our portfolio of offshore windfarms by ensuring a sustainable adoption of the products for the end-users.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Operations People and Process Excellence<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Product and Asset Implementation team where you, together with your colleagues, will work with people with diverse competencies in Global Operations and all regions in Operations. A Senior Product Adoption Specialist is an important part of Operations’ digital and innovation journey within Ørsted to help harvest the value of our digital and innovation products within the business. As part of the agile setup in our team, you’ll support the Product Owner with the responsibility of prioritising and helping to coordinate a small team of regionally based specialists. As a team, we are ambitious and passionate about change management and supporting our regions in operating smoothly with all the products offered by the Ørsted Lab.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>developing a framework for product adoption, in collaboration with the Product Managers, the Product Owners in the Agile Release Train, and regional leaders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> maintaining a product adoption backlog, incl. dependencies on other teams in Global Operations and the regions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> prioritising and aligning product adoption efforts with product teams, and, in some cases, organisational change managers, where you’ll support the designing, scoping, and planning of adoption activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> planning the approach for global\u002Fregional roll-out with the team and the Product Owners, incl. change management activities and training plan creation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring early involvement of relevant stakeholders in the regions and connecting with the regional Change Portfolio Managers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> overseeing the implementation progress and customer satisfaction, raising any impediments or risks which arise to relevant stakeholders or product teams, incl. lessons learned. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have some experience from working in an operations and maintenance environment, preferably offshore wind<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with designing and developing roll-out approaches on a global scale<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have change management experience from a big organisational environment, preferably from using the ADKAR® model<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with agile working and implementation of products, incl. digital and\u002For hardware)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have good interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate and reach agreement through flexibility and compromise within a multicultural organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience facilitating workshops and liaising with end-users from management to the end-user with technical knowledge. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 27 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Katrine Ostenfeldt, Head of Product and Asset Implementation, on (Denmark +45) 99556543, if you’d like to know more about the position.
