Danish partnership for offshore wind projects<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll support development of projects in a new partnership from a procurement perspective through the bid- and project development process. You´ll be working with our partner, Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), to develop sound and creative procurement strategies and frameworks to ensure a strong foundation for winning bids, initiating value-creating supply chains, and complying with project requirements.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to CAPEX &amp; DEVEX Procurement<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the DEVEX Procurement Management team where you, together with your colleagues, will be working closely with CIP in an integrated project team representing Ørsted. You’ll be sparring with your Ørsted team colleagues who work across the organisation in the US, Asia Pacific, and Europe as well as with specialists in our Group. The project office is located in central Copenhagen where you’ll be expected to work 3 days a week. – and out of Ørsted’s office, or remotely, for the rest of the week. As a team, we support development and work actively with knowledge-sharing to ensure best practise in an ever-changing environment. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>setting up and managing procurement and compliance-related interfaces in the partnership during the development phase to enable winning bids<\u002Fli>\n  <li> facilitating cooperation and coordination between sourcing teams in CIP and Ørsted<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting constructive communication between development projects and Ørsted’s wider organisation, e.g., procurement and product lines, and regions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preparing contract strategy or recommendations and documentation for bid projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preparing and maintaining an overview of all relevant procurement activities, e.g., contracts for individual development projects.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have strong communication and stakeholder management skills, incl. securing buy-in with- or without a formal mandate<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have project procurement experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a proactive and systematic approach to your work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive in a rapidly changing environment and possess quick decision-making skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a good proficiency in English and as the project team language will be Danish, it will be a requirement that you speak Danish.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Signe Dahl Wedel, Head of DEVEX Procurement Management, on (Denmark +45) 99557831 if you’d like to know more about the position. In our team, we seek to communicate, collaborate to succeed, and to grow our talent. We cooperate globally with our organisation in all regions, and we tackle our exciting agenda with ambition, focus, and perseverance.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>engaging with key stakeholders, incl. external auditors, and closely follow best practices within accounting and auditing and where the business is headed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> identifying risk exposure and determination of audit work to mitigate the risk exposure to a level below the risk appetite<\u002Fli>\n  <li> assessing and testing the effectiveness of internal controls, as well as sufficiency of internal policies, procedures, and governance incl. compliance with rules and regulation <\u002Fli>\n  <li>providing audit assurance to executive management and Audit &amp; Risk Committee based on conducted audits<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring delivery on the approved audit strategy and plan together with the colleagues in Group Internal Audit<\u002Fli>\n  <li> caretaking of the whistle blower hotline and confidential investigations together with experienced colleagues holding Certified Fraud Examiner certifications.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>enjoy all aspects of audit from engaging with stakeholders and information gathering to risk assessment, planning, execution, and reporting <\u002Fli>\n  <li>thrive being a team player engaging with colleagues globally and are comfortable working alone if needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> hold a genuine curiosity towards complex business models and meet challenges with a perseverant attitude<\u002Fli>\n  <li> hold a relevant financial education, e.g., a master’s degree in auditing or finance, and understand audit methodology, accounting terms and standards through extensive experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> enjoy working with and managing multiple stakeholders at various organisational levels and are comfortable being exposed to top management levels as well as the Audit &amp; Risk Committee members<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have great communication skills, a structured approach to your work and a keen eye for process improvements, and you deliver high quality even when deadlines are tight.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 20 January 2023.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Pia Elkjaer Bay, Chief Audit Executive, on (Denmark +45) 99558580 on Fridays between 10:00-11:00 GMT if you’d like to know more about the position. framework for risk management and strategic decision support <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be part of a team with several quantitative developers responsible for developing, managing, and operating our calculational framework. The framework includes Monte Carlo-based calculation engines written in Modern C++, GUI interfaces in C#, Python integration full stack web applications, PostgreSQL databases, and Linux servers. In short, you’ll get plenty of opportunities to influence, drive, and learn about anything and everything in a modern open-source Linux environment, with a little Windows on top.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Gas Portfolio Management<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Portfolio Management DK where you, together with your colleagues, will drive optimisation and decision making for gas, be it natural gas, biogas, e-fuels, or hydrogen in the future energy system. You’ll be part of a highly skilled and engaged team, working with many stakeholders across the organisation and getting the opportunity to translate mathematical quantitative theory into operational work, while learning about energy markets in practice. As a team, we enjoy a fun and challenging work environment. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>setting up, maintaining, and operating the models and tools used for optimising the Gas Portfolio<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being responsible for continuously developing and renewing tools and models for the business, together with colleagues, to ensure alignment with market conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> delivering high-quality quantitative analyses<\u002Fli>\n  <li> setting standards to improve our code quality and shape the way we deploy solutions for production<\u002Fli>\n  <li> helping to ensure operational excellence of the Gas Portfolio.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have completed a degree within computer science, engineering, data science, mathematics, statistics, physics, or other quantitative-focused disciplines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a team player with strong technical skills, motivated by understanding the business and transforming requirements into IT solutions with a variety of stakeholders in an international, English-speaking environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience working with Modern C++ and have preferably previously deployed and managed Red Hat servers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a passion for, and experience with, mathematical models, e.g., Monte Carlo Simulations, stochastic optimisation, option pricing, or linear programming<\u002Fli>\n  <li> adapt well to change and are constantly looking to challenge the norms to do things better.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Vibeke Eybye Petersen, Head of Portfolio Management DK, on (Denmark +45) 99557898, if you’d like to know more about the position. power, and ancillary services markets <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for driving our regulatory interests within the district heating sector in Denmark. You’ll use your strategic mindset and negotiation skills to identify and pursue market opportunities within the power and ancillary services markets, present them for senior management, and negotiate solutions with Danish authorities and TSOs. Participation in external forums with the purpose of nurturing relations and identify business opportunities, as well as impacting market design will also be part of the role.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Bioenergy<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Markets Development &amp; Regulation where you, together with your colleagues, will work to create and influence market designs relevant to our portfolio of combined heat and power stations in Denmark. We operate in a regulatory-commercial-technical space where we use our deep knowledge on heat, power, and carbon markets to bring the business forward on our journey to create a world that runs entirely on green energy. You’ll also have a strong collaboration with Trading Floor, heat contract managers, Bioenergy Fuel, as well as with our regulatory team. As a team, we are openminded and inclusive specialists. We have a strong collaboration both within the team, but also across Bioenergy. We enjoy a good laugh and a good atmosphere in a dynamic working environment<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>driving district heating regulation and securing organisational support<\u002Fli>\n  <li> creating an overview of commercial activities in the power and ancillary services markets and developing a strategy going forward<\u002Fli>\n  <li> identifying and executing on possible business opportunities within power and ancillary services markets<\u002Fli>\n  <li> identifying and executing on possible business opportunities within regulatory know-how.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold a master’s degree within finance, engineering, political science, or similar<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong knowledge of and experience in the heat, power, and ancillary services markets<\u002Fli>\n  <li> excel in relation management\u002Fnetworking and negotiation skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a strategic and commercial mindset<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are systematic and structured<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are fluent in English and preferably Danish.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 5 February 2023. the business collaborate securely and efficiently <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll work closely with experienced information specialists on guiding stakeholders across our business areas on information management best practices. You’ll be part of improving the information management rules and implementing them by communication and business engagement.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to QHSE<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Information Management team where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for outlining and implementing high quality information management processes in the organisation. Being part of our QHSE department, the team sets the overall governance for information management and supports all areas of the business. As a team, we’re dedicated to support the organisation globally and we take any opportunity to learn and improve our processes. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>managing projects and other activities to improve information availability and protection<\u002Fli>\n  <li> engaging proactively with the business to support compliance with the information management standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> facilitating meetings and workshops independently with stakeholders to solve complex issues related to information management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> creating attention and awareness on information risks, dos, and don’ts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> handling ad hoc requests about information access, storage, sensitivity, criticality, retention, etc.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have solid information management skills acquired from a similar position<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong analytical skills and a structured approach to your work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience as project manager<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are familiar with working with information management processes and systems in a large organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> enjoy engaging with many stakeholders at all levels and are a great team worker.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. energy company <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be a key member of our P2X Portfolio &amp; Business Intelligence team. This is the centre for our global P2X data and insights, spanning markets, technology, and competitors and is an important element in our project and business development activities. P2X involves the production of green hydrogen and e-fuels using electricity generated by clean sources, such as wind and solar. These technologies will be crucial to achieving the world’s decarbonation goals. The global P2X industry is in exponential growth, and your decisions will shape the future strategy and footprint of our business.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Power-to-X (P2X)<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of The Portfolio &amp; Business Intelligence team where you, together with your colleagues, will be part of the P2X Commercial Division, which is the growth engine for our P2X business. Our purpose is to set the strategy, understand the market, and develop investment opportunities as part of a balanced portfolio. We assess cutting-edge projects around the globe, dealing directly with many of the world’s largest and most innovative companies to drive new business. As a team, we embrace learning opportunities and support development. Your success will be supported by talented colleagues across P2X and our leading renewable energy generation businesses.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>following market developments and collecting intelligence from internal and external sources to identify key issues and trends<\u002Fli>\n  <li> maintaining, validating, consolidating, interpreting, and analysing data about the evolving P2X landscape and extracting key takeaways for senior management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting our modelling on supply, demand, and price forecasts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> proactively executing a systematic data-driven approach to identify and optimise value-creation potential in our Power-to-X projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working across our Commercial, Markets, and Projects teams to collect insights and ensure we are making data-led decisions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> delivering insightful analysis and special projects to support decision making within the Senior Leadership team.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>are an original thinker, using research, imagination, and logic to develop solutions to first-of-a-kind problems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are curious and take initiative to understand what insight is truly required to support a decision, so that efforts can be focused on the most impactful analysis<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent written, visual, and oral communication skills, with an eye for detail, as well as the ability to translate data into clear insights<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive in a high-performance and fast-growth environment, where rapid changes in the market require the agility and patience to pivot<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a master’s degree in business, economics, engineering, or similar disciplines, preferably with experience from previous work in the energy sector<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess an analytical mindset and are able to think critically and quickly grasp new topics with a passion for P2X and new technologies.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 3 February 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Christian Bridge, Head of Market &amp; You’ll work within a small, passionate team which is accountable for the development, maintenance, and support of our ‘1 to 3’ Maintenance Excellence Habits. As a team, we work closely with wind farm site and regional management, planners and schedulers, procurement, and supply chain and subject matter experts, to ensure an efficient workflow.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>identifying and driving the development of a more data-driven approach to asset maintenance plans, in close collaboration with subject matter experts, planners and schedulers, and other wind farm site and regional roles<\u002Fli>\n  <li> defining and supporting initiatives which support performance dialogues with the Head of Site, SAP implementation team, and subject matter experts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> following and evaluating developments within Region Europe in the optimisation of a user-centric approach for maintenance planning and materials management for the next few years<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading the development of a more data-driven asset plan solution, supporting the associated process of asset plan implementation and operation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> continuously following and understanding the business needs for support from the team, in alignment within the department.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>are outgoing and enjoy navigating and cooperating in a complex matrix organisation with many stakeholders – it’s therefore essential that you have excellent communication skills and speak and write English fluently<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are curious and fast in learning from our wide range of technical and commercial experts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are used to working to deadlines and have a positive attitude – also during busy periods<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have cultural awareness and experience from working in a global organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess experience within leading and developing a team in a matrix organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a strategic mindset looking for both short and mid-term pragmatic solutions, as well ensuring readiness for the future ahead.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 24 January 2023.. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> For DK, Germany, and the UK, please don’t hesitate to contact Per Lyngbo Sorensen, Head of Asset Plans &amp; Integrity, on on Thursdays and Fridays from 14:00-15:30 GMT; GMT Standard Time, if you’d like to know more about the position. <\u002Fp>\n <p>If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> 24 January 2023., 23:59 CET <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> Denmark, United Kingdom, Germany <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Gentofte, Grimsby, Norden-Norddeich <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Hybrid (office and home-working) <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> Full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Per Lyngbo Sorensen <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Head of Asset Plans &amp; Permanent"},"jobTagModel":null,"resumeEvaluationResult":null,"sanitizedJobDescription":{"content":"<div>\n <p>Imagine a future where you’re a key player in projects adjusting and developing oil and gas assets to fit the future expectations and the green transition <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be a mechanical generalist in projects with great variety from modification projects to large scale EPC projects and green transitional projects within carbon emission reduction and carbon capture and storage (CCS). You’ll work with rotating and pressurised equipment, material and valve selection, civil and piping design, plant design, and 3D modelling. You’ll also quality check documentation, provide operational and maintained support and participate in the hand-over to operators when the project is finished.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Infrastructure Assets<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Project Management Office where you, together with your colleagues, will work with projects in all phases from idea and maturation to execution and evaluation. You‘ll be working in the project organisation with a core team of nine members covering the different engineering disciplines and project management. As a team, we collaborate and share knowledge daily and focus on building a trust-based culture that makes the best platform for a great learning environment and continuous feedback.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>using your technical skills to make sure that our onshore process plant and offshore pipelines will be designed, constructed, and modified to ensure safe and efficient transportation of gas and liquid<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving the project deliveries within your technical Discipline area covering mechanical requirements and specifications on design, input in tender process, and supervision of deliveries from contractors and vendors<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preparing in-depth technical input to secure progress of the project scope of CCS feasibility projects, decommissioning projects, and other modification projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working with specific tasks related to the mechanical discipline such as condition assessments, reports, and proposals for modifications of the assets<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold an engineering degree within the mechanical discipline<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have great experience with oil &amp; gas, or similar, and have a high focus on safety<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have in-depth knowledge within some of the following technical areas: mechanical requirements and specifications, plant layout and 3D modelling, concept studies, and commissioning<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Value collaboration across your team and thrive solving complex and abstract problems together with your team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English fluently, enabling you to report and present project progress and results in an international environment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 19 January 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Gitte McCluskey Nielskov, Head of Asset Support, on (Denmark +45) 99555385 if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> 19 January 2023, 23:59 CET <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> Denmark <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Gentofte, Skærbæk <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Office-based <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> Full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Gitte McCluskey Nielskov <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Head of Asset Support <\u002Fp>\n   <p>(Denmark +45) 99555385<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>About Ørsted<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We develop, construct, and operate offshore and onshore wind farms, solar energy farms, storage facilities, and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company for the past four years.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re headquartered in Denmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We have over 7,292 employees, working in 15 countries and growing.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> An inclusive team<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted wants all employees to have the same opportunities for impact and growth, regardless of age, nationality, disability, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or beliefs. projects in the construction of our offshore wind farms <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Welcome to CAPEX &amp; DEVEX Procurement<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Execution Contract Management – US where you, together The team consists of approx. 20+ dedicated and experienced colleagues placed in Denmark, Poland, and the UK. You and your colleagues will be responsible for managing our supplier contracts in the execution phase of our projects. You’ll work closely with your peers and project team in a highly team-based environment, where we pride ourselves on a high level of professionalism and are passionate about developing and sharing best practices.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>being the key player in driving the commercial agenda in our sub-project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing the obligations and rights in our contracts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> implementing contract variations together with suppliers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> securing proactive risk management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> clarifying and settling contract claims from both parties.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have extensive experience managing contracts for large-scale construction projects for manufacturing or installation of components<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are an active and emphatic team player<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are used to managing a large group of stakeholders and interfaces across a large international company<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are able to use your experience to proactively influence the project team and the suppliers to deliver a project, as opposed to a product or a service<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a good verbal and written communicator<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are an assertive negotiator with a holistic commercial mindset.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. We aspire to consistently develop and improve through feedback and collaborative knowledge sharing, with an innovative and a commercial mindset. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>planning and executing uncrewed vessel operations across global offshore wind farm campaigns, incl. permitting, contracting, monitoring, and control of uncrewed vessels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> defining operational procedures and processes in collaboration with our autonomous systems supplier to meet regulatory requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing internal and external stakeholders in relation to the design of autonomous vessel solutions and continuous development activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> analysing operational data across our autonomous vessel fleet, planning maintenance campaigns, and conducting occasional offshore operations when required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing supplier and client contracts throughout your projects and ensuring that campaign objectives are successfully achieved.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree within engineering, a commercial area, or equivalent maritime degree, e.g., RYA or IYT Yachtmaster Offshore, Master 200, or hydrographic surveyor<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a strong track record of working with offshore operations, preferably with experience from planning and operating uncrewed vessels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are perseverant and motivated by finding original solutions to challenges that aren’t always well defined, and implementing these solutions in a structured manner<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong oral and written communication skills, with a keen focus on documentation and can engage with stakeholders at all levels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are self-driven and able to deliver results while working on several parallel workstreams across a complex matrix organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> don’t necessarily check all the points above but if you’re a proactive and quick learner, we would like to hear from you. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023.. world that runs entirely on green energy <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll work on innovative IT cloud solutions in the ever-changing and digitalised world. important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>being part of the EPIC Leadership team and supplying a holistic leadership on the technical solutions in all aspects of the Cloud solutions (NFR, technical-, financial-, legal- viability, security, and compliance, and strategic and architectural fit)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring alignment with business stakeholders that the solutions live up to the current and future business needs (Products), incl. alignment on the risk on outstanding technical debt and security risk<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring that the Architectural Runway is created, updated, aligned, and communicated to all relevant stakeholders whether that be business, the delivery organisation, or architectural community<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being responsible As a team, we collaborate closely with other teams in order to contribute to the successful completion of our offshore windfarms ensuring the works are performed under the highest quality and HSE standards.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>ensuring that the array cable supply and termination scope is on time, quality, and budget<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing the design, manufacturing, and testing of cables and related accessories<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing interfaces with internal and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring that department best practices and processes are implemented within the project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing risks.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have project management experience within the offshore industry, e.g., oil &amp; gas, wind, or other relevant experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have specific project management experience in submarine cable projects, this is not a requirement but will be positively evaluated<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have an international mindset and strive working as part of a multidisciplinary team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are an excellent communicator and speak and write English fluently.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. We offer an exciting student job in a dynamic and international environment where you’ll be responsible for handling tasks on your own, while having the opportunity to grow your professional competences and expertise.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Strategic Planning &amp; Business Continuity<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Asset Planning where you, together with your colleagues, are part of an inspiring work and learning environment with deep committed and motivated colleagues. As a team, we work closely with wind farm site and regional management, planners and schedulers, product owners, procurement, and supply chain and subject matter experts to ensure an efficient workflow.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>assisting on development, implementation, and operation of a data-driven asset plan solution<\u002Fli>\n  <li> participating in a user-centric approach for maintenance planning and efficient material management for the next few years<\u002Fli>\n  <li> assisting with the creation of annual maintenance plans and facilitating alignment between all contributors<\u002Fli>\n  <li> assisting in process mapping and handling updates to processes, instructions, and templates in our quality management system: Way we work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> administering our document management system to ensure adequate access mgmt. and control of information<\u002Fli>\n  <li> performing varied work and small internal projects.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>are studying for a bachelor’s or master’s degree in science, technology, operation and engineering management, IT, or similar and have at least two years left before graduating<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a strong flair for IT, are Office 365 super user, and have worked with visualising data in dashboards\u002Fbusiness intelligence systems during your studies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a proactive and systematic approach to your work tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a positive attitude, a strong drive, and are eager to learn<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English fluently and have excellent writing and communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> enjoy teamwork and a user-centred approach with stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 19 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Helle Holmegaard Mossing, Asset Integrity Lead, on (Denmark +45) 99557484 on Thursdays and Fridays from 13:00-16:00 CEST; Central European Summer Time if you’d like to know more about the position. drives our portfolio management and architectural best practices<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll optimise our technology and application portfolio throughout its lifecycle in collaboration with colleagues across IT. You’ll get to apply your analytical skills and technology enthusiasm to build and manage our architecture &amp; technology ecosystem to power world-class agile delivery organisations. You’ll work together with 120+ architects and our agile delivery organisation to manage, rationalise, and optimise our digital journey.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to the Architecture and Technology Community<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of our Technology and Application Portfolio Office Center of Excellence where you, together with your colleagues, will be running and improving our architecture and technology ecosystem. You’ll be part of a caring and bright team of six colleagues, and you’ll be responsible for coordinating with various stakeholders in IT to set the standards, built frameworks, and give directions for clear and efficient processes, from inception to sunsetting of applications and technologies. You’ll be considered a broad technical subject matter expert, both inside and outside the team. As a team, we’ll be ensuring that our architectural artefacts and frameworks are anchored in a solid, data driven foundation. With you on our team, we’ll drive the application that makes this happen.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>driving and operating LeanIX, our modern Enterprise Architecture tool alongside our meta model configuration and change and release management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> assessing and prioritising new feature requests in a larger Achitecture and Technology ecosystem context as well as implementing these<\u002Fli>\n  <li> identifying areas of improvement in our common Achitecture and Technology data foundation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> evangelizing our architecture and portfolio management best practices and guidelines throughout the organisation, helping colleagues to manage and transform our IT landscape<\u002Fli>\n  <li> contributing to our approach for modelling application and technology architecture, incl. relevant meta data, both in LeanIX and in other ecosystem components like ServiceNow.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>find yourself comfortable in a role with part operational and part tactical responsibilities but with immense potential for architectural competencies development<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have an analytical mindset based on a strong technical understanding<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can communicate architectural modelling and architectural practices effectively and proactively to team members, business, and IT stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can build relationships across a complex, global organisation, actively seek collaboration with peers, and involve others in decision-making and project work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience in requirements gathering, prioritisation, and delivery to different stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are curious, proactive, and want to learn and develop LeanIX.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 22 January 2023. diverse and inclusive world that runs entirely on green energy <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be the commercial lead for the sourcing of consultancy services across the globe. The scope covers a wide range of services, e.g., contingent workforce, management consultants, legal advisors, tax advisors, and insurance services. You’ll lead the category and manage the full sourcing process, incl. making a global category strategy, conducting tenders, and preparing and conducting supplier negotiations.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Welcome to Sourcing in Services Procurement<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> You’ll be part of our Services Procurements Sourcing team where you, together with two colleagues, will take responsibility for the sourcing of consultancy services, from defining the global category strategy and individual tender strategy, delivering the signed contracts within the agreed time and budget. We offer an international working environment where you’ll collaborate closely with the business and colleagues across the globe. The category strategy must be developed and maintained in close collaboration with key stakeholders from the business. As a team of approx. 20 colleagues, we value collaboration, learning from each other, and knowledge sharing.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>being responsible for the sourcing of consultancy services across all of our organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading and delivering strategic sourcing processes from start to finish, e.g., category strategy, market analysis, tender process, negotiations, and implementation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring contractual alignment between business and project objectives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> building relationships with key internal and external stakeholders to support the realisation and optimisation of commercial value<\u002Fli>\n  <li> contributing with your excellence in sourcing management, value creation, and cost-out initiatives.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a cross-disciplinary background based on a master’s degree in economics, business, or law<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with leading the strategic sourcing and negotiation process of complex projects and services, and preferably experience with EU tender law<\u002Fli>\n  <li> enjoy working in a team, have excellent stakeholder management skills, and can communicate clearly at all levels, both internally and externally<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a positive and proactive mindset, as well as a structured and analytical approach to your work, enabling you to manoeuvre and deliver business-critical sourcing projects successfully<\u002Fli>\n  <li> contribute to our department where we value knowledge sharing and care for each other.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 24 January 2023.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Jeannette Reemando Rosa, Head of Sourcing, on if you’d like to know more about the position. our wind and solar assets <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be the trusted risk manager who analyses and communicates the positioning of our assets, based on power production, weather forecast, hedging strategies, and price outlooks. To understand the risk nature of assets and contracts, you’ll engage with colleagues across the organisation while analysing production and revenue data, complex non-linear payment structures from subsidies, and power purchase agreements. You’ll also ensure that our risk systems and reporting reflect an accurate representation of the risk picture, and that risk mandates and hedging requirements are within our risk appetite. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Welcome to Welcome to Merchant Risk<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Merchant Risk UK &amp; Ireland where you, together with your seven other colleagues, will work with a large set of stakeholders across the organisation, interacting with many different nationalities and backgrounds. We’re a curious, bright, and commercially oriented group of individuals who work professionally while keeping an informal tone, with room for fun and laughter. We’ll also help you grow your talent through our ambition to understand our stakeholder’s business to a degree that we can contribute to their understanding of their market risk. As a team, we’re inspired by design thinking and prioritise time for prototypes and knowledge sharing through demos. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>identifying, understanding, and being on top of energy-related risks from assets, subsidies, and various contracts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> advising the Chief Risk Officer and senior management on energy-related risk from assets, subsidies, and contracts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> analysing and communicating the company’s risk picture and ensuring compliance with risk mandates and policies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> performing data-driven analysis and reporting on energy market risk<\u002Fli>\n  <li> taking part in various business projects.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have solid experience with market risk management or similar, and have a good understanding of derivatives, risk models, and hedging strategies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are experienced in communicating at all seniority levels in a larger organisation and are motivated to use your insights and share your opinions in open discussions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have an excellent analytical mindset and are not afraid to challenge the status quo<\u002Fli>\n  <li> find it motivating to create results through teamwork and developing good relationships with your colleagues and stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent IT skills, as we work with large data volumes and use tools such as SQL, VBA\u002FExcel, Power BI, and PowerPoint to a great extent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a master’s degree in economics, finance, mathematics, or similar and, preferably, experience within financial and\u002For energy risk management, portfolio management, etc.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 30 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Natasja Schioenning Nielsen, Head of Merchant Risk UK &amp; Ireland, on (Denmark +45) 99557317, if you’d like to know more about the position. Permanent"},"jobTagModel":null,"resumeEvaluationResult":null,"sanitizedJobDescription":{"content":"<div>\n <p>Imagine a future where you take care of some of Denmark's most important infrastructure assets, including managing our offshore pipelines in the North Sea <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll become involved in all disciplines related to the operation, inspection, maintenance, and asset management of the Danish offshore pipelines which bring most of the Danish oil and gas into Denmark. Together with your team, you’ll be responsible for approximately 800 km of offshore pipelines, incl. the associated subsea structures and risers. You'll also contribute to studies and development projects supporting our green transition, e.g., using pipelines for the transportation of hydrogen or CO2.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to infrastructure Assets<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Oil Pipeline Systems &amp; Integrity department where you, together with your colleagues, will engage in tasks, from feasibility studies, pipeline and piping engineering, contract management, to handling of emergency situations and oil spill response management. Furthermore, you'll provide support to offshore campaigns, evaluation of the inspection data, and integrity assessment. The responsibility will also involve liaising with pipeline owners and third parties, as well as some involvement in projects within transport systems for hydrogen and CO2. As a team, we have individual area of responsibilities, but we support each other when needed as we work closely together, which also includes the Gas Pipeline Systems &amp; Execution department and further, we participate in various external networks.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>participating in the planning, engineering, tendering, contracting, execution, and follow-up on offshore inspection and maintenance projects, incl. inline inspections<\u002Fli>\n  <li> liaising with authorities, consultants, contractors, oil and gas companies, and other third parties<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing support as the company representative on board contractors' offshore vessels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing quality, health, safety, and environmental (QHSE) risks associated with the operation and maintenance activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing and maintaining relevant company standards, procedures, tools, and databases related to asset management and pipeline operation activities, in accordance with best industry practice.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold a bachelor's or master's degree in engineering, preferably structural or hydrodynamic, and have a proactive and systematic approach to your tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a key focus on safety, which must be embedded in all the work you do<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience working with pipeline engineering and associated materials and integrity, as well as subsea engineering, experience with piping engineering will be beneficial as well<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have some experience working with engineering companies, contractors, and suppliers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have some experience working with pipeline operation and maintenance, incl. marine and subsea operations and inspection methods<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent communication skills and speak and write English fluently, knowledge of Danish language is an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 18 February 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Lars Erik Storck, Head of Offshore Operations, on (Denmark +45) 99556145, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that you're expected to do some travelling in relation to your work. You'll be travelling to our sites in Denmark to meet colleagues and further afield to meet contractors and suppliers in Europe, as well as some travel offshore to platform or vessels may be foreseen. It’ll be flexible and may be around 10-20% of the time.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> 18 February 2023, 23:59 CET <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> Denmark <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Gentofte <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Office-based <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> Full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Lars Erik Storck <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Head of Offshore Operations <\u002Fp>\n   <p>(Denmark +45) 99556145<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>About Ørsted<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We develop, construct, and operate offshore and onshore wind farms, solar energy farms, storage facilities, and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company for the past four years.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re headquartered in Denmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We have over 8,000 employees, working in 15 countries and growing.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> An inclusive team<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted wants all employees to have the same opportunities for impact and growth, regardless of age, nationality, disability, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or beliefs. We’re committed to secure an inclusive work environment characterised by a respect for all people so everyone feels free to openly share their input and ideas.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Why <p>Forestil dig en fremtid, hvor du bruger din teoretiske viden til at løse praktiske opgaver på vores kraftvarmeværker og udvikle bæredygtige energiløsninger<\u002Fp> \n <p>I denne rolle vil du primært være beskæftiget med trykbærende udstyr, kedler, ventiler, certificerede stålmaterialer, svejsning samt andre komponenter i vanddampkredsløbet på termiske kraftværker. Stillingen indebærer en bred kontaktflade til store dele af vores organisation, og du vil få et indblik i, hvordan vi driver vores konventionelle kraftværker, og hvordan vi sikrer bæredygtig drift. En spændende stilling, hvor du har rig mulighed for at udvikle dine faglige og analytiske kompetencer.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Velkommen til Pressurised Equipment<\u002Fb><br> Du bliver del af Plant Support, der er et område under Digitalisation &amp; Technology i EPC &amp; Operations, hvor du sammen med dine kolleger supporterer driften af vores kraftvarmeværker. I Pressurised Equipment er vi tekniske specialister, som blandt andet yder driftssupport og udarbejder forbedrings- og vedligeholdelsesopgaver for vores danske energi- og kraftvarmeværker. Vi bruger tid på at optimere værkerne i forhold til virkningsgrad, vedligehold og rådighed. Desuden medvirker vi til den fortsatte udvikling af grønne teknologier, blandt andet gennem salg af systemydelser, teknologisk udvikling og implementering af nye processer. I vores team mødes vi regelmæssigt for at drøfte og videndele information og opgaver indenfor trykbærende udstyr, hvorved vi er med til at sikre sikkerheden og kvaliteten på tværs af Ørsteds energianlæg.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> I jobbet vil du:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> blive en af vores tekniske specialister inden for trykbærende udstyr og få indgående kendskab til kedler, certificerede stålmaterialer samt svejsning på trykbærende anlæg<\u002Fli>\n  <li> sikre at det trykbærende udstyr lever om til lovgivning og vores ledelsessystemer<\u002Fli>\n  <li> udføre driftssupport samt analysere og finde tekniske fejl inden for dit specialistområde, fx. ved hjælp af vores driftsdata, tekniske dokumentation og beregninger<\u002Fli>\n  <li> optimere og udvikle kraftvarmeværkerne i forhold til virkningsgrad, vedligehold og rådighed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> udarbejde forbedrings- og vedligeholdelsesopgaver og som projektleder forestå store og små ombygninger af kraftvarmeværkerne<\u002Fli>\n  <li> udvikle nye processer og teknologier, som sikrer, at de biofyrede kraftvarmeværker fortsat er attraktive for vores kunder.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> For at få succes i denne rolle forventer vi, at du:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> har en maskinteknisk baggrund som maskiningeniør, maskinmester eller anden med høj teoretisk viden om kedler og trykbærende anlæg — kendskab til kvalitetssystemer er en fordel<\u002Fli>\n  <li> har analytiske og systematiske egenskaber til løsning af komplekse problemstillinger inden for energianlæg og arbejder målrettet ved løsning af opgaver såvel alene som i teams<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> har en faglig tilgang og praktisk indsigt i kedler og trykbærende udstyr og besidder viden om projektering, udførelse og idriftsættelse af rørsystemer og tilhørende komponenter<\u002Fli>\n  <li> har termodynamisk viden om kredsprocesser og kender de fleste komponenter i vand-eller dampprocessen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> holder af at kommunikere og kan tale og skrive såvel dansk som engelsk.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Få et job, der gør en forskel<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted er kåret som verdens mest bæredygtige energiselskab, og som global leder står vi i spidsen af klimakampen. Hos os vil du være med til at skabe og drive de ændringer, der kan lede til en grøn fremtid indenfor energi. Du vil styrke dit talent i en hurtigt voksende branche, hvor du vil have mulighed for at lære og udvikle dig gennem udfordrende opgaver og i samarbejde med førende eksperter. Her vil du arbejde i et behageligt arbejdsmiljø baseret på tillid, respekt og samarbejde.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Form fremtiden med os<\u002Fb><br> Send din ansøgning til os så hurtigt som muligt og senest den 22 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Du er velkommen til at kontakte Henrik Frahm, Senior Manager, på (Denmark +45) 99559354, hvis du vil vide mere om stillingen.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Hvis du ønsker at anmode om justeringer af arbejdsmetoder, arbejdsmønstre eller vurderings- eller interviewprocessen, tager vi med glæde en snak om alternative arrangementer.<\u002Fp>\n <p> I denne rolle må du forvente nogen rejseaktivitet, da du bliver ansvarlig for trykbærende udstyr på flere sites i hovedstadsområdet og vil have et tæt samarbejde med kollegaer på tværs af kraftværkerne i Ørsted.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Bemærk venligst, at din ansøgning kun bliver taget i betragtning, hvis den indsendes via vores online karriereside.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n landvindmølleparker samt solcelle-, energilagrings- og bioenergianlæg i Europa, Asien og Nord Amerika.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Vores vision er at skabe en verden, der udelukkende kører på grøn energi.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Vi er de seneste fire år blevet kåret som verdens mest bæredygtige energiselskab.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Vi har hovedsæde i Danmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Vi har mere end 7.292 medarbejdere globalt og kontorer i 15 lande.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> Et inkluderende team<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted ønsker at alle medarbejdere har samme muligheder for at gøre en forskel uanset alder, nationalitet, funktionsnedsættelse, etnicitet, køn, seksuel orientering eller tro. mobile app with real impact on service execution<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be the responsible Product Owner (PO) for the in-house development and operation of the offshore wind technicians key field service mobile app. Together with the Technician App product team and by engaging with various stakeholders and end-users, you’ll lead the lifecycle of products through agile product management methods. You'll play a key role in identifying issues and opportunities, developing product and life cycle strategies, and delivering end2end impact through minimum viable solutions, trialling proof of concept to full roll-out, and continual tracking of the value generated.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Operations Digital &amp; Innovation Business Applications Product Line<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Technician App team where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for reliable operations and fit for purpose functionality of our offshore wind technician mobile app and related API’s. This will be done through daily operational tasks and maintenance, end-user support, incident handling, and facilitating the product development and strategy to support the business development and global growth. As a team, we strive to simplify and support the daily work of wind technicians as well as bring valuable data and insights from their service execution back to the site and global operations organisation.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>driving stakeholder engagement, solution discovery, and roadmap alignment initiatives as well as end-user support<\u002Fli>\n  <li> owning the product roadmap both outwards, to your colleagues, and inwards, towards the development team, ensuring that both parties are continuously aligned<\u002Fli>\n  <li> shaping and prioritising a valuable backlog of features, ensuring adequate refinement and effective delivery, managing change as needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> facilitating input to and verify the architectural runway and application of emerging technologies and potentially related business applications.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> delivering and tracking value, usage, and satisfaction, adhering to the product vision and business impact.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>empathise with the users of the products and strive to solve their problems by conveying business needs into digital priorities, whilst optimising business value<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with product ownership, preferably from an agile environment and with end2end product lifecycle management framework and mindset<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have proven ability to engage and communicate effectively with a broad group of stakeholders with different priorities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience from offshore wind or other relevant industry with focus on mobile app development<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are comfortable and effective at working with globally distributed teams and like to work in a multinational environment with multi-disciplinary teams.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. Frigast Als, Product Owner, on (Denmark +45) 99557126 if you’d like to know more about the position. <\u002Fp>\n <p>If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or globally expanding offshore portfolio <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll develop global supply chain and inland logistics products across our offshore fleet. You'll be part of a dedicated product team that develops and implements products through iterations using agile product management. You'll play a key role in the identification of issues and opportunities, scoping new solutions and developing the business case to minimum viable product, trialling proof of concept through to roll-out.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Welcome to Operations Product Lines<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Operations Digital &amp; Innovation where you, together with more than 50 colleagues, will push the boundaries of offshore operations. You'll be an essential innovation specialist in the product team shaping supply chain and inland logistics concepts for our new and existing offshore asset projects. Your team mission is to drive novel products, workstreams, customers, and interfaces in a matrix organisation across back and front office.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>providing supply chain and inland logistics innovation development to support new and existing offshore windfarms<\u002Fli>\n  <li> executing innovations through to the completion and implementation stage<\u002Fli>\n  <li> engaging with our other supply chain functions, our operating regions, as well as wind farm projects in development, to optimise and innovate<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing specialist skills in supply chain data and logistics optimisation to ensure wider strategy, whilst also preparing material to support the decision-making process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing opportunities and scenarios for supply chain and inland logistics concepts for the portfolio and our operating regions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> using your knowledge and interest in the trends, technologies, and market moves within the supply chain and inland logistics area.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have experience working as a supply chain and logistics specialist in the wind power industry, or in similar global supply chain setups with multiple locations, suppliers, technical spares, and scopes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have hands-on experience with supply chain management software, e.g., SAP, PowerBI, or similar, and have structured execution skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a critical thinker with problem-solving skills; You’ll be an integral part of a team with competent and committed colleagues who value and emphasise knowledge sharing and collaboration as a way of working. You'll play a key role in identifying issues and opportunities, developing product and lifecycle strategies, and delivering end-to-end impact through minimum viable solutions, trialling proof of concept to full roll-out and continual tracking of the value generated. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Welcome to Operations Digital &amp; Innovation, Business Applications Product Line<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of our Asset Integrity Management and Asset Monitoring teams where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for reliable operations and fit-for-purpose functionality of our asset integrity monitoring tools and related APIs. You’ll do so through daily operational tasks and maintenance, end-user support, and facilitating the product development and strategy to support the business development and global growth. As a team, we aim to give the organisation complete knowledge of, and control over, the integrity of its assets by working closely together with inspection data providers, specialists, and other up-\u002Fdownstream product teams.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>empathising with the users of the products and striving to solve their problems whilst maximising business value<\u002Fli>\n  <li> owning the product roadmap outwards, towards the users, and inwards, towards the development team, ensuring they’re aligned, comfortable with, and excited about the journey<\u002Fli>\n  <li> shaping and prioritising a valuable backlog of features, ensuring adequate refinement and effective delivery, managing change as needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> verifying and facilitating input to the architectural runway and application of emerging technologies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> delivering and tracking value, usage, and satisfaction, adhering to the product vision and business impact.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a proven track record of driving agile user-oriented business improvements through digital support<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience from offshore wind or other relevant industry, with a focus on asset integrity management or incident handling<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have proven ability to engage with a broad group of stakeholders with different priorities and are comfortable and effective at working with globally distributed teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong English written and spoken communication skills to convey business needs into digital priorities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are pragmatic, have a can-do attitude, and enjoy being proactive, with an innovative mindset.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Kirstine Frigast Als, Product Owner, on (Denmark +45) 99557126 if you’d like to know more about the position.
