Permanent"},"jobTagModel":null,"resumeEvaluationResult":null,"sanitizedJobDescription":{"content":"<div>\n <p>Imagine a future where you optimise our wind turbine technology and create a world that runs entirely on green energy <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be an essential player in evaluating state-of-the art blade designs and technologies, with a focus on composite manufacturing and materials, as well as load and aerodynamic performance enhancing features. You’ll be working in close contact with the wind turbine suppliers in preparing turbines for our future wind farms. You'll be responsible for managing an array of technical matters, with a focus on blades and other composite components.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Welcome to Wind Turbine Components<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Wind Turbine Components team where you, together with your colleagues, will support the business throughout the value chain, incl. evaluation of emerging technologies, technical qualification of wind turbine suppliers, procurement negotiations, participation in wind farm projects, and support to the operation of our wind farms. We do this by facilitating and influencing industry standards, setting technical requirements for our wind turbine suppliers, analysing risks, identifying risk barriers, and developing performance improvements. You’ll be part of a team of 15 specialists responsible for all mechanical and electrical parts of the wind turbine. As a team, we engage with the desire to understand and influence the wind industry, our suppliers and their solutions, as well as our internal stakeholders and their needs. We follow up on risks to minimise potential impact to our business execution.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>gathering technical requirements for wind turbine contracts in alignment with internal stakeholders, incl. wind farm operation and Technical Risk management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> taking part in quality assurance of project deliveries from our wind turbine suppliers by converting technical risks into requirements for test and inspection<\u002Fli>\n  <li> following up on technical issues during design, manufacturing, and installation, while working together with internal and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading blades-related R&amp;D activities involving internal and external industry stakeholders and being a part of Ørsted Blade Competence Centre<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting Operations with troubleshooting, lifetime assessments, technical changes, and other initiatives for reducing the maintenance cost or extending the lifetime of turbines.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in mechanical engineering, or a similar technical background<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with composites design and\u002For manufacturing, preferably from the wind turbine blade industry<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preferably have a good insight into quality management and reliability of wind turbine blades through specifications for materials, manufacturing processes, inspections, testing, and verification in view of known failure modes and service strategies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are proactive in your communication by involving stakeholders in discussions and taking ownership of your own and colleagues’ deliverables and contributions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> challenge the status quo to encourage the team to perform at its best<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive in an international environment and are experienced in creating good relationships with your internal and external stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 20 February 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Please don’t hesitate to contact Irina Sova, Head of Wind Turbine Components, on , if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> 20 February 2023, 23:59 CET <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> Denmark <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Gentofte, Skærbæk <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Hybrid (office and home-working) <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> Full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Irina Sova <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Head of Wind Turbine Components<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>About Ørsted<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We develop, construct, and operate offshore and onshore wind farms, solar energy farms, storage facilities, and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company for the past four years.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re headquartered in Denmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We have over 8,000 employees, working in 15 countries and growing.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> An inclusive team<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted wants all employees to have the same opportunities for impact and growth, regardless of age, nationality, disability, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or beliefs. <p>Forestil dig en fremtid, hvor du får foden indenfor hos en stor international virksomhed og er med til at sikre driften af vores termiske anlæg<\u002Fp> \n <p>I denne rolle vil du varetage den daglige drift af vores produktionsanlæg sammen med dine kolleger, hvilket bl.a. inkluderer at forberede og sikre anlæg i forbindelse med vedligehold samt at optimere anlægsydelser, rådighed og driftsøkonomi.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Velkommen til Herningværket<\u002Fb><br> Du bliver del af Asset Operation som er et dynamisk team på 15 maskinmestre og 3 driftsspecialarbejdere. I driften på værket sikrer vi at værkets el og varmeproduktion følger behovet, og vi medvirker til at værkets kapacitet på 78 MW (max. el-produktion) og 200 MJ\u002Fs (max. varmeproduktion) kan udnyttes optimalt. Du bliver en del af et team med et afvekslende og fagligt inspirerende arbejdsmiljø.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> I jobbet vil du:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> løse driftsopgaver, herunder sikringsopgaver på anlæg i forbindelse med vedligeholdelse<\u002Fli>\n  <li> efter en introduktionsperiode indgå i en vagtordning med treholdsskift - en del af disse vagter er alenevagter<\u002Fli>\n  <li> optimere anlægsydelser, rådighed og driftsøkonomi i samarbejde med dine kolleger<\u002Fli>\n  <li> deltage i kompetenceteams, der er inddelt i forskellige fagområder<\u002Fli>\n  <li> deltage i tværfaglige drifts- og projektrelaterede opgaver.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> For at få succes i denne rolle forventer vi, at du:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> har en uddannelse som maskinmester, gerne kombineret med erfaring fra større procesanlæg, som styres fra et centralt kontrolrum<\u002Fli>\n  <li> har gode IT-evner og flair for at tilegne dig kendskab til vores overvågningssystemer<\u002Fli>\n  <li> behersker både dansk og engelsk i skrift og tale, da vi har flere internationale samarbejdspartnere<\u002Fli>\n  <li> har en ansvarsbevidst indstilling til dit arbejde og trives med at arbejde både selvstændigt og sammen med dine kolleger i mindre teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> tager ejerskab for dine opgaver, er fagligt ambitiøs og i stand til at bevare overblikket, når der er travlt.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Få et job, der gør en forskel<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted er kåret som verdens mest bæredygtige energiselskab, og som global leder står vi i spidsen af klimakampen. Hos os vil du være med til at skabe og drive de ændringer, der kan lede til en grøn fremtid indenfor energi. Du vil styrke dit talent i en hurtigt voksende branche, hvor du vil have mulighed for at lære og udvikle dig gennem udfordrende opgaver og i samarbejde med førende eksperter. Her vil du arbejde i et behageligt arbejdsmiljø baseret på tillid, respekt og samarbejde.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Form fremtiden med os<\u002Fb><br> Send din ansøgning til os så hurtigt som muligt og senest den 31 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Du er velkommen til at kontakte Rasmus Madsen, Manager, på (Denmark +45) 99552896, hvis du vil vide mere om stillingen.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Hvis du ønsker at anmode om justeringer af arbejdsmetoder, arbejdsmønstre eller vurderings- eller interviewprocessen, tager vi med glæde en snak om alternative arrangementer.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Bemærk venligst, solcelle-, energilagrings- og bioenergianlæg i Europa, Asien og Nord Amerika.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Vores vision er at skabe en verden, der udelukkende kører på grøn energi.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Vi er de seneste fire år blevet kåret som verdens mest bæredygtige energiselskab.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Vi har hovedsæde i Danmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Vi har mere end 7.292 medarbejdere globalt og kontorer i 15 lande.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> Et inkluderende team<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted ønsker at alle medarbejdere har samme muligheder for at gøre en forskel uanset alder, nationalitet, funktionsnedsættelse, etnicitet, køn, seksuel orientering eller tro. Work with enthusiastic people with a global mindset and enjoy an innovative environment where challenging and interesting work with purpose is part of daily life. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>evangelising our security best practices, guidelines, and blueprints throughout the organisation, helping colleagues to build secure solutions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading design and assurance of the security architecture and processes on our AWS platform<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing minimum security requirements for infrastructure, platforms, and applications, based on their risk profiles<\u002Fli>\n  <li> assisting colleagues in building scalable security architectures.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have extensive experience with architecting cloud landing-zones and solutions, incl. relevant certifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess relevant certifications, such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate and AWS Certified Security – Specialist<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess an innovative and explorative approach to solving problems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a keen interest in information security, incl. the challenges and trade-offs involved<\u002Fli>\n  <li> build relationships with relevant stakeholders across the business and IT, actively seek collaboration with peers, and involve others in decision-making and project work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess good interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 13 February 2023. maintenance regime and integrity of our substations <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for determining the maintenance regime of the mechanical systems in the onshore and offshore substations on our 28 sites in operation and 13 asset projects\u002Fsites under development. You’ll also have the opportunity to participate in the development of innovative maintenance solutions.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Asset Integrity Management for the Transmission Systems<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of AIM Transmission Systems team where you, together with your colleagues, will contribute to ensuring the integrity of the mechanical assets on our onshore and offshore substations. The department has offices in various locations in Denmark, London, and Kuala Lumpur, while other interfacing colleagues are in our Regional HUBs in UK East, UK West, The Netherlands, Germany, the US, and Taiwan, amongst other places. As a team, we are passionate about helping the site uphold the integrity of the asset in operation, finding innovative ways to optimise performance and bring our learnings into the many new asset projects under way.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>defining the preventive maintenance scope for the mechanical systems on the substations e.g., for HVAC, fire safety systems, compressors, sea water cooling systems, diesel generators, and heat exchangers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the root cause analysis on failure modes and identifying long-term mitigation actions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading the corrective integrity cases for the mechanical systems on the substations and raising relevant cases to the OEM, together with our Warranty Management department<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the new asset projects during the transfer process to Operations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold a relevant degree in mechanical or marine engineering, and are interested in working with mechanical systems for onshore and offshore substations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have relevant experience from power plants, offshore HVAC and HVDC substations, or offshore oil and gas projects with mechanical systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have good communication skills and an analytical approach to your work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> like to be part of a team that is passionate about helping the site uphold the integrity of the asset in operation. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 20 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Henriette Molberg Knutzen, Head of HV &amp; Cables, on (Denmark +45) 99559150 on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 10:00-17:00 GMT; GMT Standard Time, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> 20 January 2023, 23:59 CET <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> Denmark <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Gentofte <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Hybrid (office and home-working) <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> Full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Henriette Molberg Knutzen <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Head of HV &amp; <p>Imagine a future where you plan, produce, and advise on HR communication that reaches thousands of colleagues in the world’s most sustainable energy company <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll help ensure consistent, global, and receiver-oriented communication that contributes to ensuring that people at Ørsted can thrive, perform, and grow.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Employer Branding &amp; HR Communication<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the HR Communication team where you, together with three other communication specialists, will help your 190 colleagues in People &amp; Development plan and produce their company-wide communication. Together with Employer Branding, we’re an inclusive, dedicated, and ambitious group of thirteen communication and branding colleagues who love professional discussions, laughs, and who value you for the perspectives you bring.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>planning, reviewing, and producing global internal communication about HR activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> advising colleagues about the best communication approach to getting their messages across and helping them scope their communication products, in accordance with Ørsted’s communication guidelines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> delivering the communication for internal events, campaigns, and large internal conferences<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing communication projects at each stage of the process, from planning to execution, and handling the production of communication materials by coordinating with graphic designers and other internal and external suppliers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> maintaining our communication framework, toolbox, and annual communication plan.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a relevant master’s degree in communication studies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience from a similar internal communication position, as well as with planning communication, developing key messages, producing texts for intranets, newsletters, guides, and campaign material<\u002Fli>\n  <li> know how to use the journalist’s toolbox to communicate complex matters so they’re easy to understand, and to frame texts for different target groups and communication channels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are able to manage projects and stakeholders and to reach compromises without compromising the quality of the final product<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English fluently, enabling you to communicate smoothly, correctly, and efficiently across our international organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are structured, detail-oriented, and perseverant, and able to contribute with creative ideas for concepts and following those ideas through.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 28 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Anja Basilio Fabech, Head of HR Communication, on (Denmark +45) 99558076 on Mondays to Fridays from 09:00-15:00 CET if you’d like to know more about the position. Strategy team, on Ørsted’s overall strategy and key strategic projects across our portfolio. A role in Corporate Strategy not only ensures a high degree of impact for the future of the most sustainable energy company in the world, but also a high degree of personal development across problem-solving and project management.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Welcome to Corporate Strategy<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Corporate Strategy where you, together with your colleagues, will work as an in-house consulting team supporting our CEO, CFO, Regions, P2X, and Sustainability, on various strategic topics. You’ll also be part of the wider Strategy area which together helps define the overall strategic agenda for the organisation. The position entails a high degree of stakeholder management for the various parts of the organisation. Our team is positioned centrally and we typically need to manage viewpoints for different stakeholders and consolidate these into holistic recommendations. As a team, we are committed to working for a world that runs entirely on green energy, ensuring a high degree of team feeling, and to developing your skills and talents for a successful future career at Ørsted. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>supporting and driving complex strategic projects for the Group Executive team, incl. problem solving, development of top-down storylines, and insights which will lay the foundation for strategic decisions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> analysing quantitative and qualitative information from across the organisation and from external sources, translating this into clear insights<\u002Fli>\n  <li> identifying challenges and opportunities for the organisation to scope and drive strategic projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing key stakeholders across the organisation to best drive projects forward with the necessary input, and ensure alignment where needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> helping build and prepare internal and external presentations and decision materials for the Group Executive team and the Board of Directors.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have +4 experience in top-tier consulting or strategy in major companies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a high willingness to learn, a can-do mindset for challenging tasks, and a strong personal drive to get your tasks done<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have personal drive and ambition to help solve the global climate challenge and key challenges facing the energy sector today<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong analytical skills and an ability to distil key insights from a large amount of information<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a curious and collaborative mindset and a strong ability to work with people across different disciplines.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 1 February 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>For urgent questions, please reach out to contact Vilhelm Vig Nielsen, Head of Corporate Strategy, on (Denmark +45) 99556484 on Mondays from 10:00-10:30 GMT if you’d like to know more about the position. wind farm development projects <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be part of a team that develops global wind farm projects, assessing and optimising wind farm conceptual designs.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Wind Farm Concept Integration<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Concept Integration, a growing team of 10+ enthusiastic and highly skilled people, where you, together with your colleagues, will work closely with a wide range of stakeholders in a global setup, covering all technical and commercial aspects of the wind farm design. Our mission is to deliver the best decision basis for global wind farm development opportunities across regions. You’ll report to the Head of Concept Integration and project managers. We have many stakeholders within the organisation, allowing for ample learning and improvement opportunities. As a team, we are diverse, with a range of shared talents that are action-orientated and service-minded, with expert knowledge of wind farm engineering.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>optimising projected wind farm layouts, conceptual technical designs, and installation set-ups to improve the technical solution and business case<\u002Fli>\n  <li> analysing and coordinating internal and external stakeholders’ input in relation to the technical design envelope and consent or permitting processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> coordinating, challenging, and ensuring alignment across all business case drivers, incl. technical specifications, capital, operational and abandonment expenditures, energy yield, and risk<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing how we work with our service offerings and processes through improved methodologies, tools, and new technology, in collaboration with the team and stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>preferably have a master’s degree in engineering or a similar discipline<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with offshore wind farms or offshore work within the field of wind turbines, electrical systems, or offshore installation processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a good analytical understanding of the cross-disciplinary dynamic between technical solutions and business cases<\u002Fli>\n  <li> enjoy working with many stakeholders and tasks and have strong communication and collaboration skills.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 27 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Julian Ralf Jensen, Head of Wind Farm Concept Integration, on (Denmark +45) 99556187, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> 27 January 2023, 23:59 CET <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> Denmark <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Gentofte <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Office-based <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> Full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Julian Ralf Jensen <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Manager <\u002Fp>\n   <p>(Denmark +45) 99556187<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>About Ørsted<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We develop, construct, and operate offshore and onshore wind farms, solar energy farms, storage facilities, and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company for the past four years.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re headquartered in Denmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We have over 7,292 employees, working in 15 countries and growing.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> An inclusive team<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted wants all employees to have the same opportunities for impact and growth, regardless of age, nationality, disability, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or beliefs. carbon market and carbon credits in general <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for driving our commercial interest in the regulatory and commercial framework around the voluntary carbon market and the negative emissions from our carbon capture and storage projects. You’ll play a central role in understanding and influencing the regulatory framework of the voluntary carbon market, interpretation of Paris Agreement Article 6, and other relevant regulation. Continuous follow up and action on European and COP-processes, as well as driving the certification process will also be relevant parts of the role.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Bioenergy<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Markets Development &amp; Regulation where you, together with your colleagues, will work to create and influence market designs relevant to our portfolio of combined heat and power stations in Denmark. We operate in a regulatory-commercial-technical space where we use our deep knowledge on heat, power, and carbon markets to bring the business forward on our journey to create a world that runs entirely on green energy. You’ll also have a strong collaboration with our sustainability team working with nature-based carbon solutions projects, as well as with our regulatory team. As a team, we are openminded and inclusive specialists. We have a strong collaboration both within the team, but also across Bioenergy. We enjoy a good laugh and a good atmosphere in a dynamic working environment.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>engaging in processes that define and develop international regulatory and policy roadmap for carbon credits for carbon capture and storage<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving our agenda for carbon credits on both national and international level, incl. engaging with stakeholders, such as certification schemes, think tanks, opinion leaders, and policy makers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting commercial opportunities for carbon credits from our carbon capture and storage projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> securing internal alignment with sustainability targets, nature-based carbon credits, and other relevant regulatory affairs.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold a master’s degree within finance, law, international business, forestry, sustainability, or similar<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong knowledge of and experience in the carbon market as well as EU carbon policy, the Paris Agreement, and the global carbon policy development<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are trustworthy and have established connections to relevant stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a relation expert and have excellent stakeholder management competences<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are fluent in English and preferably have some Danish skills.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 22 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Randi Skytte, Senior Manager, on (Denmark +45) 99558148, if you’d like to know more about the position. Work with enthusiastic people with a global mindset and enjoy an innovative environment where challenging and interesting work with purpose is part of daily life. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>driving roadmaps for cloud technologies and components for our platform, while incorporating security controls<\u002Fli>\n  <li> influencing and driving the cloud transformation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> overseeing and migrating workloads e.g., servers and applications alongside the Centre of Excellence<\u002Fli>\n  <li> implementing a strong DevOps culture and CI\u002FCD principles for automating infrastructure as code for our Platform teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing technical direction and support throughout the implementation process.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have expert knowledge with Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with integration and API development, and are familiar with Kubernetes and container tech<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, and FaaS technologies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with IaC, coding\u002Fscripting (SQL, Python, PowerShell, or similar) and are well-versed in DevOps automation tools<\u002Fli>\n  <li> extensive experience with the design and development of complex application architecture and system landscape<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong cooperation capabilities with a solid operational experience, and the ability to solve problems alongside stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 13 February 2023. wind within an industry-leading company pushing for global change<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for our commercial baseline and be a key driver for our supply chain strategy and the development of our global supply chain across the world. You’ll be part of a highly capable team with both technical and commercial expertise. We’re looking for an ambitious and talented category manager within the field of Floating Foundations &amp; Mooring, who can drive change and overcome challenges.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to DEVEX and CAPEX Procurement<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Floating Wind Supply Chain &amp; Procurement team where you, together with your colleagues, will develop and drive world-class category management in floating offshore wind. You’ll develop the supply chain strategy for the newly established Floating Foundations &amp; Mooring category, and you’ll be the main person responsible for seeing that strategy through to realisation by working with colleagues in the technical organisation and project-oriented departments, as well as with external parties such as suppliers and partners. <\u002Fp>\n <p>As a team, we value flexibility, being self-driven, good collaboration, and the possibility to grow as a person.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>screening, understanding, and developing a fit-for-purpose supply chain, whether based on large EPC contracts, multi-contracting, or a combination of the two<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing the category strategy for floating wind, most importantly floating foundation developers, floater manufacturers, and mooring and anchor suppliers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> advising the floating wind business on contracting models, package composition, and go-to market strategy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> constantly staying on top of current market developments and supplier landscapes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> conducting cost structure analyses<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading negotiations and sourcing projects.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a master’s degree in engineering or in the commercial field and have successfully created and executed procurement strategies for complex technologies and supply chains and know how to guide the process end-to-end<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have relevant experience from Offshore Wind, Oil &amp; Gas, heavy steel, and\u002For concrete manufacturing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a strong business orientation and experience with supplier development, should-cost analysis, various contracting models, and risk-sharing strategies for complex, managed, asset-heavy services<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent negotiation and communication skills, combined with a driven personality, enabling you to take the lead and create results<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English fluently, are innovative, and can manage change, as the floating wind business grows from a lean start-up-like unit to a more experienced delivery organisation.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Joern Mester, Head of Floating Wind, on (Denmark +45) 99558131, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> 31 January 2023, 23:59 CET <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> Denmark <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Gentofte, Skærbæk <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Hybrid (office and home-working) <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> Full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Joern Mester <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Head of Floating Wind <\u002Fp>\n   <p>(Denmark +45) 99558131<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>About Ørsted<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We develop, construct, and operate offshore and onshore wind farms, solar energy farms, storage facilities, and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company for the past four years.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re headquartered in Denmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We have over 7,292 employees, working in 15 countries and growing.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> An inclusive team<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted wants all employees to have the same opportunities for impact and growth, regardless of age, nationality, disability, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or beliefs. The Cyber Defence Centre is an agile delivery organisation where you and the team are playing an important role. In the Cyber Defence Centre, we have experts in both offensive and defensive security. We ensure that you will have excellent opportunities for best practice sharing and learning across Product Owner disciplines in our Competency Centre.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> You’ll play an important role in:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> defining the product vision and strategic roadmap for the area, and prioritising and refining backlog together with the team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring that outcome of product capabilities is aligned with objectives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> securing operations quality and quantity and ensuring they are aligned with commitments towards business stakeholders, as well as compliance requirements across global footprint of the organisation’s production assets.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> have strong strategic product understanding, interpersonal skills, and have the ability to successfully orchestrate cross-organisational communities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have the ability and like to communicate to relevant stakeholders and the product team, so all are aligned and excited about the product´s strategic roadmap<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong experience as a Product Owner in the field, know about product management, SAFe, or other agile frameworks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess knowledge in any or all areas: detection, monitoring, security assessments, security technologies important to those activities, as well as security in general<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preferably possess experience that include operational technology and security frameworks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> communicate fluently in English, both verbally and in writing, and enjoy global engagements.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. There are currently five employees in the team and they are located in DK and PL. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>developing, implementing, and maintaining features with CI\u002FCD Azure Pipelines to ensure automated code deployment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing governance on agreed coding standards, documentation standards, and repositories<\u002Fli>\n  <li> evaluating existing systems, solutions, and processes and providing ideas for improvement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> prioritising and enforcing security and governance on the entire cloud platform using Azure Policies, Defender, and other tools.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have solid experience with Azure development, preferably from automation development using CI\u002FCD pipelines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with access management with setup of RBAC roles and authorisations in Azure<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with Containerization and Orchestration, where Kubernetes cluster setup experience is a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess knowledge about Cloud Governance: Azure Policies deployment, automation, and compliance reporting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with provisioning Azure DevOps and Terraform, with knowledge of GitHub being a plus.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Send your application to us no later than 20 February 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Michal Zdanowski, Head of Infrastructure ＆ SO, on (Poland +48) 573790082, if you’d like to know more about the position. wind within an industry-leading company pushing for global change<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for our commercial baseline and be a key driver for our supply chain strategy and the development of our global supply chain across the world. You’ll be part of a highly capable team with both technical and commercial expertise. We’re looking for an ambitious, talented category manager within the field of Floating Wind Construction &amp; Installation, who can drive change and overcome challenges.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to DEVEX and CAPEX Procurement<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Floating Wind Supply Chain &amp; Procurement team where you, together with your colleagues, will develop and drive world-class category management in floating offshore wind. You’ll develop the supply chain strategy for the newly established Floating Wind Construction &amp; Installation category, and you’ll be the main person responsible for seeing that strategy through to realisation by working with colleagues in the technical organisation and project-oriented departments, as well as with external parties such as suppliers and partners. As a team, we value flexibility, being self-driven, good collaboration, and the possibility to grow as a person.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>screening, understanding, and developing a fit-for-purpose supply chain, whether based on large EPC contracts, multi-contracting, or a combination of the two<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing the category strategy for floating wind, most importantly contractors for mooring and anchor installation, in-port logistics, tow-out and hook-up, or cable system installation contractors<\u002Fli>\n  <li> advising the floating wind business on contracting models, package composition, and go-to market strategy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> constantly staying on top of current market developments and supplier landscapes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> conducting cost structure analyses<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading negotiations and sourcing projects.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a master’s degree in engineering or in the commercial field and have successfully created and executed procurement strategies for complex technologies and supply chains and know how to guide the process end-to-end.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have relevant experience from Offshore Wind, Oil &amp; Gas, marine operations, or offshore construction<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a strong business orientation and experience with supplier development, should-cost analysis, various contracting models, and risk-sharing strategies for complex, managed, asset-heavy services<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent negotiation and communication skills, combined with a driven personality, enabling you to take the lead and create results<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English fluently, are innovative, and can manage change as the floating wind business grows from a lean start-up-like unit to a more experienced delivery organisation.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Joern Mester, Head of Floating Wind, on (Denmark +45) 99558131, if you’d like to know more about the position.
